 9667 | micromark utility to classify whether a character is whitespace or punctuation.
 9668 | 
 9669 | ## Contents
 9670 | 
 9671 | *   [Install](#install)
 9672 | *   [Use](#use)
 9673 | *   [API](#api)
 9674 |     *   [`classifyCharacter(code)`](#classifycharactercode)
 9675 | *   [Security](#security)
 9676 | *   [Contribute](#contribute)
 9677 | *   [License](#license)
 9678 | 
 9679 | ## Install
 9680 | 
 9681 | [npm][]:
 9682 | 
 9683 | ```sh
 9684 | npm install micromark-util-classify-character
 9685 | ```
 9686 | 
 9687 | ## Use
 9688 | 
 9689 | ```js
 9690 | /** @type {Tokenizer} */
 9691 | function tokenizeAttention(effects, ok) {
 9692 |   return start
 9693 | 
 9694 |   // …
 9695 | 
 9696 |   /** @type {State} */
 9697 |   function sequence(code) {
 9698 |     if (code === marker) {
 9699 |       // …
 9700 |     }
 9701 | 
 9702 |     const token = effects.exit('attentionSequence')
 9703 |     const after = classifyCharacter(code)
 9704 |     const open =
 9705 |       !after || (after === constants.characterGroupPunctuation && before)
 9706 |     const close =
 9707 |       !before || (before === constants.characterGroupPunctuation && after)
 9708 |     // …
 9709 |   }
 9710 | 
 9711 |   // …
 9712 | }
 9713 | ```
 9714 | 
 9715 | ## API
 9716 | 
 9717 | This module exports the following identifiers: `classifyCharacter`.
 9718 | There is no default export.
 9719 | 
 9720 | ### `classifyCharacter(code)`
 9721 | 
 9722 | Classify whether a
 9723 | [character code](https://github.com/micromark/micromark#preprocess)
 9724 | represents whitespace, punctuation, or
 9725 | something else.
 9726 | Used for attention (emphasis, strong), whose sequences can open or close based
 9727 | on the class of surrounding characters.
 9728 | 
 9729 | Note that eof (`null`) is seen as whitespace.
 9730 | 
 9731 | ###### Returns
 9732 | 
 9733 | `constants.characterGroupWhitespace`, `constants.characterGroupPunctuation`,
 9734 | or `undefined.`
 9735 |

 9981 | ## What is this?
 9982 | 
 9983 | This package exposes an algorithm to decode numeric character references.
 9984 | 
 9985 | ## When should I use this?
 9986 | 
 9987 | This package might be useful when you are making your own micromark extensions.
 9988 | 
 9989 | ## Install
 9990 | 
 9991 | This package is [ESM only][esm].
 9992 | In Node.js (version 16+), install with [npm][]:
 9993 | 
 9994 | ```sh
 9995 | npm install micromark-util-decode-numeric-character-reference
 9996 | ```
 9997 | 
 9998 | In Deno with [`esm.sh`][esmsh]:
 9999 | 
10000 | ```js
10001 | import {decodeNumericCharacterReference} from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-decode-numeric-character-reference@1'
10002 | ```
10003 | 
10004 | In browsers with [`esm.sh`][esmsh]:
10005 | 
10006 | ```html
10007 | <script type="module">
10008 |   import {decodeNumericCharacterReference} from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-decode-numeric-character-reference@1?bundle'
10009 | </script>
10010 | ```
10011 | 
10012 | ## Use
10013 | 
10014 | ```js
10015 | import {decodeNumericCharacterReference} from 'micromark-util-decode-numeric-character-reference'
10016 | 
10017 | decodeNumericCharacterReference('41', 16) // 'A'
10018 | decodeNumericCharacterReference('65', 10) // 'A'
10019 | decodeNumericCharacterReference('A', 16) // '\n'
10020 | decodeNumericCharacterReference('7F', 16) // '�' - Control
10021 | decodeNumericCharacterReference('110000', 16) // '�' - Out of range
10022 | ```
10023 | 
10024 | ## API
10025 | 
10026 | This module exports the identifier:
10027 | [`decodeNumericCharacterReference`][api-decode-numeric-character-reference].
10028 | There is no default export.
10029 | 
10030 | ### `decodeNumericCharacterReference(value, base)`
10031 | 
10032 | Turn the number (in string form as either hexa- or plain decimal) coming from
10033 | a numeric character reference into a character.
10034 | 
10035 | Sort of like `String.fromCharCode(Number.parseInt(value, base))`, but makes
10036 | non-characters and control characters safe.
10037 | 
10038 | ###### Parameters
10039 | 
10040 | *   `value` (`string`)
10041 |     — value to decode
10042 | *   `base` (`number`, probably `10` or `16`)
10043 |     — numeric base
10044 | 
10045 | ###### Returns
10046 | 
10047 | Character (`string`).
10048 | 
10049 | ## Types
10050 | 
10051 | This package is fully typed with [TypeScript][].
10052 | It exports no additional types.
10053 | 
10054 | ## Compatibility
10055 | 
10056 | Projects maintained by the unified collective are compatible with all maintained
10057 | versions of Node.js.
10058 | As of now, that is Node.js 16+.
10059 | Our projects sometimes work with older versions, but this is not guaranteed.
10060 | 
10061 | This package works with `micromark` version 3+.

10406 | dealt with.

10541 | ## What is this?
10542 | 
10543 | This package exposes a list of known tag names to markdown.
10544 | 
10545 | ## When should I use this?
10546 | 
10547 | This package is only useful if you want to build an alternative to micromark.
10548 | 
10549 | ## Install
10550 | 
10551 | This package is [ESM only][esm].
10552 | In Node.js (version 16+), install with [npm][]:
10553 | 
10554 | ```sh
10555 | npm install micromark-util-html-tag-name
10556 | ```
10557 | 
10558 | In Deno with [`esm.sh`][esmsh]:
10559 | 
10560 | ```js
10561 | import {htmlBlockNames, htmlRawNames} from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-html-tag-name@1'
10562 | ```
10563 | 
10564 | In browsers with [`esm.sh`][esmsh]:
10565 | 
10566 | ```html
10567 | <script type="module">
10568 |   import {htmlBlockNames, htmlRawNames} from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-html-tag-name@1?bundle'
10569 | </script>
10570 | ```
10571 | 
10572 | ## Use
10573 | 
10574 | ```js
10575 | import {htmlBlockNames, htmlRawNames} from 'micromark-util-html-tag-name'
10576 | 
10577 | console.log(htmlBlockNames) // ['address', 'article', …]
10578 | console.log(htmlRawNames) // ['pre', 'script', …]
10579 | ```
10580 | 
10581 | ## API
10582 | 
10583 | This module exports the identifiers [`htmlBlockNames`][api-html-block-names]
10584 | and [`htmlRawNames`][api-html-raw-names].
10585 | There is no default export.
10586 | 
10587 | ### `htmlBlockNames`
10588 | 
10589 | List of lowercase HTML “block” tag names (`Array<string>`).
10590 | 
10591 | The list, when parsing HTML (flow), results in more relaxed rules (condition
10592 | 6\).
10593 | Because they are known blocks, the HTML-like syntax doesn’t have to be strictly
10594 | parsed.
10595 | For tag names not in this list, a more strict algorithm (condition 7) is used
10596 | to detect whether the HTML-like syntax is seen as HTML (flow) or not.
10597 | 
10598 | This is copied from:
10599 | <https://spec.commonmark.org/0.30/#html-blocks>.
10600 | 
10601 | > 👉 **Note**: `search` was added in `CommonMark@0.31`.
10602 | 
10603 | ### `htmlRawNames`
10604 | 
10605 | List of lowercase HTML “raw” tag names (`Array<string>`).
10606 | 
10607 | The list, when parsing HTML (flow), results in HTML that can include lines
10608 | without exiting, until a closing tag also in this list is found (condition
10609 | 1\).
10610 | 
10611 | This module is copied from:
10612 | <https://spec.commonmark.org/0.30/#html-blocks>.
10613 | 
10614 | > 👉 **Note**: `textarea` was added in `CommonMark@0.30`.
10615 | 
10616 | ## Types
10617 | 
10618 | This package is fully typed with [TypeScript][].
10619 | It exports no additional types.

10626 | Our projects sometimes work with older versions, but this is not guaranteed.
10627 | 
10628 | This package works with `micromark` version 3+.

10740 | ## What is this?
10741 | 
10742 | This package exposes an algorithm to normalize identifiers found in markdown.
10743 | 
10744 | ## When should I use this?
10745 | 
10746 | This package might be useful when you are making your own micromark extensions.
10747 | 
10748 | ## Install
10749 | 
10750 | This package is [ESM only][esm].
10751 | In Node.js (version 16+), install with [npm][]:
10752 | 
10753 | ```sh
10754 | npm install micromark-util-normalize-identifier
10755 | ```
10756 | 
10757 | In Deno with [`esm.sh`][esmsh]:
10758 | 
10759 | ```js
10760 | import {normalizeIdentifier} from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-normalize-identifier@1'
10761 | ```
10762 | 
10763 | In browsers with [`esm.sh`][esmsh]:
10764 | 
10765 | ```html
10766 | <script type="module">
10767 |   import {normalizeIdentifier} from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-normalize-identifier@1?bundle'
10768 | </script>
10769 | ```
10770 | 
10771 | ## Use
10772 | 
10773 | ```js
10774 | import {normalizeIdentifier} from 'micromark-util-normalize-identifier'
10775 | 
10776 | normalizeIdentifier(' a ') // 'A'
10777 | normalizeIdentifier('a\t\r\nb') // 'A B'
10778 | normalizeIdentifier('ТОЛПОЙ') // 'ТОЛПОЙ'
10779 | normalizeIdentifier('Толпой') // 'ТОЛПОЙ'
10780 | ```
10781 | 
10782 | ## API
10783 | 
10784 | This module exports the identifier
10785 | [`normalizeIdentifier`][api-normalize-identifier].
10786 | There is no default export.
10787 | 
10788 | ### `normalizeIdentifier(value)`
10789 | 
10790 | Normalize an identifier (as found in references, definitions).
10791 | 
10792 | Collapses markdown whitespace, trim, and then lower- and uppercase.
10793 | 
10794 | Some characters are considered “uppercase”, such as U+03F4 (`ϴ`), but if their
10795 | lowercase counterpart (U+03B8 (`θ`)) is uppercased will result in a different
10796 | uppercase character (U+0398 (`Θ`)).
10797 | So, to get a canonical form, we perform both lower- and uppercase.
10798 | 
10799 | Using uppercase last makes sure keys will never interact with default
10800 | prototypal values (such as `constructor`): nothing in the prototype of `Object`
10801 | is uppercase.
10802 | 
10803 | ###### Parameters
10804 | 
10805 | *   `value` (`string`)
10806 |     — identifier to normalize
10807 | 
10808 | ###### Returns
10809 | 
10810 | Normalized identifier (`string`).
10811 |

10907 | 
10908 | # micromark-util-resolve-all
10909 | 
10910 | [![Build][build-badge]][build]
10911 | [![Coverage][coverage-badge]][coverage]
10912 | [![Downloads][downloads-badge]][downloads]
10913 | [![Size][bundle-size-badge]][bundle-size]
10914 | [![Sponsors][sponsors-badge]][opencollective]
10915 | [![Backers][backers-badge]][opencollective]
10916 | [![Chat][chat-badge]][chat]
10917 | 
10918 | micromark utility to resolve subtokens.
10919 | 
10920 | [Resolvers][resolver] are functions that take events and manipulate them.
10921 | This is needed for example because media (links, images) and attention (strong,
10922 | italic) aren’t parsed left-to-right.
10923 | Instead, their openings and closings are parsed, and when done, their openings
10924 | and closings are matched, and left overs are turned into plain text.
10925 | Because media and attention can’t overlap, we need to perform that operation
10926 | when one closing matches an opening, too.
10927 | 
10928 | ## Contents
10929 | 
10930 | *   [Install](#install)
10931 | *   [Use](#use)
10932 | *   [API](#api)
10933 |     *   [`resolveAll(constructs, events, context)`](#resolveallconstructs-events-context)
10934 | *   [Security](#security)
10935 | *   [Contribute](#contribute)
10936 | *   [License](#license)
10937 | 
10938 | ## Install
10939 | 
10940 | [npm][]:
10941 | 
10942 | ```sh
10943 | npm install micromark-util-resolve-all
10944 | ```
10945 | 
10946 | ## Use
10947 | 
10948 | ```js
10949 | import {push} from 'micromark-util-chunked'
10950 | import {resolveAll} from 'micromark-util-resolve-all'
10951 | 
10952 | /**
10953 |  * @type {Resolver}
10954 |  */
10955 | function resolveAllAttention(events, context) {
10956 |   // …
10957 | 
10958 |   // Walk through all events.
10959 |   while (++index < events.length) {
10960 |     // Find a token that can close.
10961 |     if (
10962 |       events[index][0] === 'enter' &&
10963 |       events[index][1].type === 'attentionSequence' &&
10964 |       events[index][1]._close
10965 |     ) {
10966 |       open = index
10967 | 
10968 |       // Now walk back to find an opener.
10969 |       while (open--) {
10970 |         // Find a token that can open the closer.
10971 |         if (
10972 |           // …
10973 |         ) {
10974 |           // …
10975 | 
10976 |           // Opening.
10977 |           nextEvents = push(nextEvents, [
10978 |             // …
10979 |           ])
10980 | 
10981 |           // Between.
10982 |           nextEvents = push(
10983 |             nextEvents,
10984 |             resolveAll(
10985 |               context.parser.constructs.insideSpan.null,
10986 |               events.slice(open + 1, index),
10987 |               context
10988 |             )
10989 |           )
10990 | 
10991 |           // Closing.
10992 |           nextEvents = push(nextEvents, [
10993 |             // …
10994 |           ])
10995 | 
10996 |           // …
10997 |         }
10998 |       }
10999 |     }
11000 |   }
11001 | 
11002 |   // …
11003 | }
11004 | ```
11005 | 
11006 | ## API
11007 | 
11008 | This module exports the following identifiers: `resolveAll`.
11009 | There is no default export.
11010 | 
11011 | ### `resolveAll(constructs, events, context)`
11012 | 
11013 | Call all `resolveAll`s in `constructs`.
11014 | 
11015 | ###### Parameters
11016 | 
11017 | *   `constructs` (`Construct[]`) — List of constructs, optionally with
11018 |     `resolveAll`s
11019 | *   `events` (`Event[]`) — List of events
11020 | *   `context` (`TokenizeContext`) — Context used by `tokenize`
11021 | 
11022 | ###### Returns
11023 | 
11024 | `Events[]` — Changed events.
11025 |

11126 | ## What is this?
11127 | 
11128 | This package exposes an algorithm to make URLs safe.
11129 | 
11130 | ## When should I use this?
11131 | 
11132 | This package might be useful when you are making your own micromark extensions.
11133 | 
11134 | ## Install
11135 | 
11136 | This package is [ESM only][esm].
11137 | In Node.js (version 16+), install with [npm][]:
11138 | 
11139 | ```sh
11140 | npm install micromark-util-sanitize-uri
11141 | ```
11142 | 
11143 | In Deno with [`esm.sh`][esmsh]:
11144 | 
11145 | ```js
11146 | import {sanitizeUri} from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-sanitize-uri@1'
11147 | ```
11148 | 
11149 | In browsers with [`esm.sh`][esmsh]:
11150 | 
11151 | ```html
11152 | <script type="module">
11153 |   import {sanitizeUri} from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-sanitize-uri@1?bundle'
11154 | </script>
11155 | ```
11156 | 
11157 | ## Use
11158 | 
11159 | ```js
11160 | import {sanitizeUri} from 'micromark-util-sanitize-uri'
11161 | 
11162 | sanitizeUri('https://example.com/a&amp;b') // 'https://example.com/a&amp;amp;b'
11163 | sanitizeUri('https://example.com/a%b') // 'https://example.com/a%25b'
11164 | sanitizeUri('https://example.com/a%20b') // 'https://example.com/a%20b'
11165 | sanitizeUri('https://example.com/👍') // 'https://example.com/%F0%9F%91%8D'
11166 | sanitizeUri('https://example.com/', /^https?$/i) // 'https://example.com/'
11167 | sanitizeUri('javascript:alert(1)', /^https?$/i) // ''
11168 | sanitizeUri('./example.jpg', /^https?$/i) // './example.jpg'
11169 | sanitizeUri('#a', /^https?$/i) // '#a'
11170 | ```
11171 | 
11172 | ## API
11173 | 
11174 | This module exports the identifiers [`normalizeUri`][api-normalize-uri] and
11175 | [`sanitizeUri`][api-sanitize-uri].
11176 | There is no default export.
11177 | 
11178 | ### `normalizeUri(value)`
11179 | 
11180 | Normalize a URL.
11181 | 
11182 | Encode unsafe characters with percent-encoding, skipping already encoded
11183 | sequences.
11184 | 
11185 | ###### Parameters
11186 | 
11187 | *   `value` (`string`)
11188 |     — URI to normalize
11189 | 
11190 | ###### Returns
11191 | 
11192 | Normalized URI (`string`).
11193 | 
11194 | ### `sanitizeUri(url[, pattern])`
11195 | 
11196 | Make a value safe for injection as a URL.
11197 | 
11198 | This encodes unsafe characters with percent-encoding and skips already
11199 | encoded sequences (see [`normalizeUri`][api-normalize-uri]).
11200 | Further unsafe characters are encoded as character references (see
11201 | [`micromark-util-encode`][micromark-util-encode]).
11202 | 
11203 | A regex of allowed protocols can be given, in which case the URL is sanitized.
11204 | For example, `/^(https?|ircs?|mailto|xmpp)$/i` can be used for `a[href]`, or
11205 | `/^https?$/i` for `img[src]` (this is what `github.com` allows).
11206 | If the URL includes an unknown protocol (one not matched by `protocol`, such
11207 | as a dangerous example, `javascript:`), the value is ignored.
11208 | 
11209 | ###### Parameters
11210 | 
11211 | *   `url` (`string`)
11212 |     — URI to sanitize
11213 | *   `pattern` (`RegExp`, optional)
11214 |     — allowed protocols
11215 | 
11216 | ###### Returns
11217 | 
11218 | Sanitized URI (`string`).
11219 | 
11220 | ## Types
11221 | 
11222 | This package is fully typed with [TypeScript][].
11223 | It exports no additional types.
11224 | 
11225 | ## Compatibility
11226 | 
11227 | Projects maintained by the unified collective are compatible with all maintained
11228 | versions of Node.js.
11229 | As of now, that is Node.js 16+.
11230 | Our projects sometimes work with older versions, but this is not guaranteed.
11231 | 
11232 | This package works with `micromark` version 3+.

11800 | ## When should I use this?
11801 | 
11802 | <!-- Note: this section has to be in sync with the monorepo readme. -->
11803 | 
11804 | *   If you *just* want to turn markdown into HTML (with maybe a few extensions)
11805 | *   If you want to do *really complex things* with markdown
11806 | 
11807 | See [§ Comparison][comparison] for more info
11808 | 
11809 | ## What is this?
11810 | 
11811 | <!-- Note: this section has to be in sync with the monorepo readme. -->
11812 | 
11813 | `micromark` is an open source markdown parser written in JavaScript.
11814 | It’s implemented as a state machine that emits concrete tokens, so that every
11815 | byte is accounted for, with positional info.
11816 | It then compiles those tokens directly to HTML, but other tools can take the
11817 | data and for example build an AST which is easier to work with
11818 | ([`mdast-util-to-markdown`][mdast-util-to-markdown]).
11819 | 
11820 | While most markdown parsers work towards compliancy with CommonMark (or GFM),
11821 | this project goes further by following how the reference parsers (`cmark`,
11822 | `cmark-gfm`) work, which is confirmed with thousands of extra tests.
11823 | 
11824 | Other than CommonMark and GFM, micromark also supports common extensions to
11825 | markdown such as MDX, math, and frontmatter.
11826 | 
11827 | These npm packages have a sibling project in Rust:
11828 | [`markdown-rs`][markdown-rs].
11829 | 
11830 | *   to learn markdown, see this [cheatsheet and tutorial][cheat]
11831 | *   for more about us, see [`unifiedjs.com`][site]
11832 | *   for updates, see [Twitter][]
11833 | *   for questions, see [Discussions][chat]
11834 | *   to help, see [contribute][] and [sponsor][] below
11835 | 
11836 | ## Install
11837 | 
11838 | <!-- Note: this section has to be in sync with the monorepo readme. -->
11839 | 
11840 | This package is [ESM only][esm].
11841 | In Node.js (version 16+), install with [npm][]:
11842 | 
11843 | ```sh
11844 | npm install micromark
11845 | ```
11846 | 
11847 | In Deno with [`esm.sh`][esmsh]:
11848 | 
11849 | ```js
11850 | import {micromark} from 'https://esm.sh/micromark@3'
11851 | ```
11852 | 
11853 | In browsers with [`esm.sh`][esmsh]:
11854 | 
11855 | ```html
11856 | <script type="module">
11857 |   import {micromark} from 'https://esm.sh/micromark@3?bundle'
11858 | </script>
11859 | ```
11860 | 
11861 | ## Use
11862 | 
11863 | <!-- Note: this section has to be in sync with the monorepo readme. -->
11864 | 
11865 | Typical use (buffering):
11866 | 
11867 | ```js
11868 | import {micromark} from 'micromark'
11869 | 
11870 | console.log(micromark('## Hello, *world*!'))
11871 | ```
11872 | 
11873 | Yields:
11874 | 
11875 | ```html
11876 | <h2>Hello, <em>world</em>!</h2>
11877 | ```
11878 | 
11879 | You can pass extensions (in this case [`micromark-extension-gfm`][gfm]):
11880 | 
11881 | ```js
11882 | import {micromark} from 'micromark'
11883 | import {gfm, gfmHtml} from 'micromark-extension-gfm'
11884 | 
11885 | const value = '* [x] contact@example.com ~~strikethrough~~'
11886 | 
11887 | const result = micromark(value, {
11888 |   extensions: [gfm()],
11889 |   htmlExtensions: [gfmHtml()]
11890 | })
11891 | 
11892 | console.log(result)
11893 | ```
11894 | 
11895 | Yields:
11896 | 
11897 | ```html
11898 | <ul>
11899 | <li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> <a href="mailto:contact@example.com">contact@example.com</a> <del>strikethrough</del></li>
11900 | </ul>
11901 | ```
11902 | 
11903 | Streaming interface:
11904 | 
11905 | ```js
11906 | import {createReadStream} from 'node:fs'
11907 | import {stream} from 'micromark/stream'
11908 | 
11909 | createReadStream('example.md')
11910 |   .on('error', handleError)
11911 |   .pipe(stream())
11912 |   .pipe(process.stdout)
11913 | 
11914 | function handleError(error) {
11915 |   // Handle your error here!
11916 |   throw error
11917 | }
11918 | ```
11919 | 
11920 | ## API
11921 | 
11922 | `micromark` core has two entries in its export map: `micromark` and
11923 | `micromark/stream`.
11924 | 
11925 | `micromark` exports the identifier [`micromark`][api-micromark].
11926 | `micromark/stream` exports the identifier [`stream`][api-stream].
11927 | There are no default exports.
11928 | 
11929 | The export map supports the [`development` condition][development].
11930 | Run `node --conditions development module.js` to get instrumented dev code.
11931 | Without this condition, production code is loaded.
11932 | See [§ Size & debug][size-debug] for more info.
11933 | 
11934 | ### `micromark(value[, encoding][, options])`
11935 | 
11936 | Compile markdown to HTML.
11937 | 
11938 | ###### Parameters
11939 | 
11940 | *   `value` (`string` or [`Buffer`][buffer])
11941 |     — markdown to parse
11942 | *   `encoding` (`string`, default: `'utf8'`)
11943 |     — [character encoding][encoding] to understand `value` as when it’s a
11944 |     `Buffer`
11945 | *   `options` ([`Options`][api-options], optional)
11946 |     — configuration
11947 | 
11948 | ###### Returns
11949 | 
11950 | Compiled HTML (`string`).
11951 | 
11952 | ### `stream(options?)`
11953 | 
11954 | Create a duplex (readable and writable) stream.
11955 | 
11956 | Some of the work to parse markdown can be done streaming, but in the
11957 | end buffering is required.
11958 | 
11959 | micromark does not handle errors for you, so you must handle errors on whatever
11960 | streams you pipe into it.
11961 | As markdown does not know errors, `micromark` itself does not emit errors.
11962 | 
11963 | ###### Parameters
11964 | 
11965 | *   `options` ([`Options`][api-options], optional)
11966 |     — configuration
11967 | 
11968 | ###### Returns
11969 | 
11970 | Duplex stream.
11971 | 
11972 | ### `Options`
11973 | 
11974 | Configuration (TypeScript type).
11975 | 
11976 | ##### Fields
11977 | 
11978 | ###### `allowDangerousHtml`
11979 | 
11980 | Whether to allow (dangerous) HTML (`boolean`, default: `false`).
11981 | 
11982 | The default is `false`, which still parses the HTML according to `CommonMark`
11983 | but shows the HTML as text instead of as elements.
11984 | 
11985 | Pass `true` for trusted content to get actual HTML elements.
11986 | See [§ Security][security].
11987 | 
11988 | ###### `allowDangerousProtocol`
11989 | 
11990 | Whether to allow dangerous protocols in links and images (`boolean`, default:
11991 | `false`).
11992 | 
11993 | The default is `false`, which drops URLs in links and images that use dangerous
11994 | protocols.
11995 | 
11996 | Pass `true` for trusted content to support all protocols.
11997 | 
11998 | URLs that have no protocol (which means it’s relative to the current page, such
11999 | as `./some/page.html`) and URLs that have a safe protocol (for images: `http`,
12000 | `https`; for links: `http`, `https`, `irc`, `ircs`, `mailto`, `xmpp`), are
12001 | safe.
12002 | All other URLs are dangerous and dropped.
12003 | See [§ Security][security].
12004 | 
12005 | ###### `defaultLineEnding`
12006 | 
12007 | Default line ending to use when compiling to HTML, for line endings not in
12008 | `value` (`'\r'`, `'\n'`, or `'\r\n'`; default: first line ending or `'\n'`).
12009 | 
12010 | Generally, `micromark` copies line endings (`\r`, `\n`, `\r\n`) in the markdown
12011 | document over to the compiled HTML.
12012 | In some cases, such as `> a`, CommonMark requires that extra line endings are
12013 | added: `<blockquote>\n<p>a</p>\n</blockquote>`.
12014 | 
12015 | To create that line ending, the document is checked for the first line ending
12016 | that is used.
12017 | If there is no line ending, `defaultLineEnding` is used.
12018 | If that isn’t configured, `\n` is used.
12019 | 
12020 | ###### `extensions`
12021 | 
12022 | Array of syntax extensions (`Array<SyntaxExtension>`, default: `[]`).
12023 | See [§ Extensions][extensions].
12024 | 
12025 | ###### `htmlExtensions`
12026 | 
12027 | Array of syntax extensions (`Array<HtmlExtension>`, default: `[]`).
12028 | See [§ Extensions][extensions].
12029 | 
12030 | ## Types
12031 | 
12032 | This package is fully typed with [TypeScript][].
12033 | It exports the additional type [`Options`][api-options].

12651 | # MurmurHash.js
12652 | 
12653 | An optimized JavaScript implementation of the MurmurHash algorithms.
12654 | 
12655 | These algorithms take a JavaScript string (and a seed), and quickly create a non-cryptographic 32-bit hash from it. And by quick I mean sub-millisecond performance.
12656 | 
12657 | More information about these algorithms can be found at:
12658 | 
12659 | *	[MurmurHash Homepage](http://sites.google.com/site/murmurhash/)
12660 | *	[Wikipedia Entry on MurmurHash](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MurmurHash) 
12661 | 
12662 | ## Install
12663 | 
12664 |     npm install murmurhash-js
12665 |     
12666 | ## API
12667 | 
12668 | ```javascript
12669 | var murmur = require("murmurhash-js")
12670 | ```
12671 | 
12672 | ### Methods
12673 | 
12674 | #### `murmur.murmur2(key, seed)`
12675 | Runs the murmur2 hash algorithm on the string `key` with initial seed `seed`.
12676 | 
12677 | #### `murmur.murmur3(key, seed)`
12678 | Runs the murmur3 hash algorithm on the string `key` with initial seed `seed`.
12679 | 
12680 | **Note** `require("murmur-hash")` is the same as `murmur.murmur3`
12681 |

14599 | 
14600 | <h1 align="center">
14601 |   recent-searches 🕵️‍♀️🕵️‍♂️
14602 |   <br>
14603 |   <br>
14604 | </h1>
14605 | <p align="center" style="font-size: 1.2rem;">A zero dependency JavaScript module that helps anyone build recent searches functionality into their search bar.
14606 | </p>
14607 | 
14608 | 
14609 | <hr />
14610 | 
14611 | [![Build Status][build-badge]][build]
14612 | [![downloads][downloads-badge]][npmcharts] [![version][version-badge]][package]
14613 | [![MIT License][license-badge]][license]
14614 | [![PRs Welcome][prs-badge]][prs]
14615 | [![size][size-badge]][unpkg-dist] [![gzip size][gzip-badge]][unpkg-dist]
14616 | 
14617 | ![Example implementation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/JonasBa/recent-searches/master/RecentSearchesUX.gif)
14618 | 
14619 | ## The problem
14620 | 
14621 | Building recent searches experience can be trickier than you think (expiry of queries, ranking of recent queries, handling storage etc...)
14622 | 
14623 | ## Solution
14624 | recent-searches module helps you build that experience without having to focus on the edge cases and technical details. If available, uses [localStorage](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/localStorage) to store suggestions cross sessions and in the rare cases where it might not be available uses a fallback memory storage, thus loosing it's cross session functionality.
14625 | 
14626 | __The module handles:__
14627 | - Searching and retrieving recent searches
14628 | - Ranking of searches and decaying their popularity (with different ranking options)
14629 | - Saving and expiring of searches through LocalStorage or MemoryStorage
14630 | - LocalStorage feature detection (with fallback to MemoryStorage)
14631 | - Safe LocalStorage usage (feature detection, limiting storage)
14632 |

14644 | ## Installation
14645 | 
14646 | recent-searches is published on npm's public registry, you can install it as a dependancy of your project with the following command.
14647 | ```
14648 | npm install --save recent-searches
14649 | ```
14650 | 
14651 | ## Usage
14652 | 
14653 | > [Standalone codesandbox example](https://codesandbox.io/s/8k21924m5l) <br/>
14654 | > [Algolia react-instantsearch codesandbox example](https://codesandbox.io/s/m18wjy69) <br/>
14655 | > [Algolia InstantSearch.js codesandbox example](https://codesandbox.io/s/62j3k7097r)
14656 | Initializing the module
14657 | 
14658 | ```ts
14659 | import RecentSearches from 'recent-searches'
14660 | 
14661 | const searches = new RecentSearches({
14662 |   ttl: number, // Optional: ttl of searches in milliseconds, default to 24h (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24)
14663 |   limit: number, // Optional: max number of entries that will be persisted, default is 50
14664 |   namespace: string, // Optional: custom localStorage namespace
14665 |   ranking: string // Optional: ranking strategy of recent searches, "PROXIMITY" | "TIME" | "PROXIMITY_AND_TIME", default is "PROXIMITY_AND_TIME"
14666 | })
14667 | 
14668 | ```
14669 | 
14670 | Setting and retrieving relevant searches.
14671 | 
14672 | ```ts
14673 | // Retrieve searches for a given query
14674 | const previousSearchesForJohn = searches.getRecentSearches("John")
14675 | /* 
14676 |   [ 
14677 |     {query: "John", data: {...}, timestamp: ...},
14678 |     {query: "Marc John", data: {...}, timestamp: ...}
14679 |   ] 
14680 | */
14681 | 
14682 | // To set a recent search
14683 | searches.setRecentSearch("John", resultData)
14684 | 
14685 | ```
14686 | 
14687 | If you built something using recent-searches that you want to show, feel free to send us a link and we'll include it to the documentation!

36 |         this.projectID,
37 |         filename,
38 |         locale,
39 |         downloadParams
40 |       );
41 |     } catch (err) {
42 |       console.log(err);
43 |     }

47 |     const uploadParams = new UploadFileParameters()
48 |       .setFileFromLocalFilePath(filepath.toString())
49 |       .setDirective("entity_escaping", "false")
50 |       .setFileType(FileType.GETTEXT)

52 |     uploadParams.set("authorize", "true");

  1 | import { i18nextToPo, gettextToI18next } from "i18next-conv";
  2 | import fs from "fs";
  3 | import { SmartlingAPI } from "./api.js";
  4 | import i18nConfig from "../smartling.config.js";
  5 | 
  6 | function relURL(path) {
  7 |   return new URL(path, import.meta.url);
  8 | }
  9 | 
 10 | async function main() {
 11 |   if (process.argv.length < 2) {
 12 |     throw new Error(
 13 |       "Invalid args - Usage: node index.js [pull|push|usepo|usecsv] (args?)"
 14 |     );
 15 |   }
 16 |   const commandName = process.argv[2];
 17 | 
 18 |   const commands = {
 19 |     pull: pull, // Pull translations to smartling
 20 |     push: push, // Push translations from smartling
 21 |     usepo: usepo, // import a .po file (convert to .json)
 22 |     usecsv: usecsv, // import a .csv file (convert to .json)
 23 |   };
 24 | 
 25 |   // Check if command is valid
 26 |   if (!commands.hasOwnProperty(commandName)) {
 27 |     throw new Error(
 28 |       "First arg invalid, must be a valid command: [pull|push|usepo|usecsv]"
 29 |     );
 30 |   }
 31 | 
 32 |   if (commandName === "pull" || commandName === "push") {
 33 |     // Check if config is valid
 34 |     //  NOOP if invalid config - that indicates this project is not using Smartling
 35 |     if (!i18nConfig.userID || !i18nConfig.userSecret || !i18nConfig.projectID) {
 36 |       console.log(
 37 |         `'smartling ${commandName}: NOOP - initialize smartling integration by filling out 'i18n/smartling/smartling.config.js'`
 38 |       );
 39 |       return;
 40 |     }
 41 | 
 42 |     // Initialize the API
 43 |     const api = new SmartlingAPI(i18nConfig);
 44 |     await commands[commandName](api);
 45 |     return;
 46 |   }
 47 | 
 48 |   if (commandName === "usepo" || commandName === "usecsv") {
 49 |     // expect an argument "fileName" describing which .po file to use
 50 |     if (!process.argv[3]) {
 51 |       console.log(
 52 |         "i18n usePo: NOOP - missing [locale].po fileName as first arg"
 53 |       );
 54 |       return;
 55 |     }
 56 | 
 57 |     await commands[commandName](process.argv[3]);
 58 |     return;
 59 |   }
 60 | }
 61 | 
 62 | async function pull(api) {
 63 |   // Check config.locales exists
 64 |   if (i18nConfig.locales === undefined || i18nConfig.locales.length === 0) {
 65 |     throw new Error(
 66 |       "smartling pull: Error - must define locales in `i18n/smartling/smartling.config.js > locales`"
 67 |     );
 68 |   }
 69 | 
 70 |   i18nConfig.locales.forEach(async (locale) => {
 71 |     // Skip processing source locale, there are no translations to pull
 72 |     // and we don't want to overwrite local changes to translation files
 73 |     // such as handling plurals.
 74 |     if (locale === i18nConfig.defaultLocale) return;
 75 | 
 76 |     // Check if the yext/smartling locale name is different
 77 |     let apiLocale = locale;
 78 |     const localeMap = i18nConfig.smartlingLocaleToYextLocaleMapping;
 79 |     if (localeMap != null) {
 80 |       Object.entries(localeMap).forEach(([smartlingLocale, yextLocaleList]) => {
 81 |         if (yextLocaleList.includes(locale)) {
 82 |           apiLocale = smartlingLocale;
 83 |         }
 84 |       });
 85 |     }
 86 | 
 87 |     // Download the translations & write to filesystem
 88 |     const localeTranslations = await api.download("native.po", apiLocale);
 89 | 
 90 |     const options = {
 91 |       compatibilityJSON: "v3",
 92 |     };
 93 |     gettextToI18next(apiLocale, localeTranslations, options).then((output) => {
 94 |       const outDirPath = relURL(`../locales/${locale}/`);
 95 |       try {
 96 |         fs.accessSync(outDirPath);
 97 |       } catch (err) {
 98 |         fs.mkdirSync(outDirPath, { recursive: true });
 99 |       }
100 |       const outFilepath = new URL("translation.json", outDirPath);
101 |       if (localeTranslations) {
102 |         console.log("Writing to " + outFilepath);
103 |         fs.writeFileSync(
104 |           outFilepath,
105 |           JSON.stringify(JSON.parse(output), null, 2) + "\n",
106 |           { flag: "w" }
107 |         );
108 |       }
109 |     });
110 |   });
111 | }
112 | 
113 | async function push(api) {
114 |   // Read `config.defaultLocale` translations (fallback to 'en' if this field is empty)
115 |   let defaultSource = "{}";
116 |   let defaultLocale = i18nConfig.defaultLocale || "en";
117 |   try {
118 |     defaultSource = fs.readFileSync(
119 |       relURL(`../locales/${defaultLocale}/translation.json`),
120 |       "utf-8"
121 |     );
122 |   } catch (err) {
123 |     console.log(
124 |       `couldn\'t find "translation.json" source file for ${defaultLocale}`
125 |     );
126 |   }
127 | 
128 |   const source = {
129 |     ...JSON.parse(defaultSource),
130 |   };
131 | 
132 |   // convert file to .po format && write to filesystem
133 |   // we need to convert JSON to .po because smartling doesn't support
134 |   //  i18next JSON's plural format
135 |   const options = {
136 |     compatibilityJSON: "v3",
137 |   };
138 |   i18nextToPo("en", JSON.stringify(source), options).then(async (output) => {
139 |     const outFilepath = relURL("./native.po");
140 |     fs.writeFileSync(outFilepath, output, { flag: "w" });
141 |     console.log("Uploading native.po to smartling...");
142 |     await api.upload(outFilepath.pathname, "native.po");
143 |     fs.unlinkSync(outFilepath);
144 |   });
145 | }
146 | 
147 | // Convert a .po file into a translation.json file
148 | //  expects the file `fileName.po` to be in the `locales` directory
149 | //
150 | // This script is intended to be used when an existing soy repo with .po translations
151 | //  needs to be converted to react and there isn't a smartling project to import on.
152 | async function usepo(fileName) {
153 |   let oldPoTranslations = "{}";
154 |   // Read the contents of the old .po file
155 |   try {
156 |     oldPoTranslations = fs.readFileSync(
157 |       relURL(`../locales/${fileName}`),
158 |       "utf-8"
159 |     );
160 |   } catch (err) {
161 |     console.log(
162 |       `couldn't find file 'locales/${fileName}. Are you sure it is in the 'locales' directory?`
163 |     );
164 |   }
165 | 
166 |   // Assume the fileName is always [locale].po, so to get the locale just remove the extension
167 |   const fileLocale = fileName.split(".")[0];
168 | 
169 |   // Translate the file from .po to .json and write to disk
170 |   const options = {
171 |     compatibilityJSON: "v3",
172 |   };
173 |   gettextToI18next(fileLocale, oldPoTranslations, options).then((output) => {
174 |     const outDirPath = relURL(`../locales/${fileLocale}/`);
175 |     try {
176 |       fs.accessSync(outDirPath);
177 |     } catch (err) {
178 |       fs.mkdirSync(outDirPath, { recursive: true });
179 |     }
180 |     const outFilepath = new URL("translation.json", outDirPath);
181 |     if (oldPoTranslations) {
182 |       console.log("Writing to " + outFilepath);
183 |       fs.writeFileSync(
184 |         outFilepath,
185 |         JSON.stringify(JSON.parse(output), null, 2) + "\n",
186 |         { flag: "w" }
187 |       );
188 |     }
189 |   });
190 | }
191 | 
192 | async function usecsv(fileName) {
193 |   // TODO @aliang: implement this? idk if it will actually be useful
194 |   console.log(
195 |     "this has not been implemented yet, probably because nobody has need to use it yet."
196 |   );
197 | }
198 | 
199 | await main();

/src/common/createCtx.ts:

 1 | import { createContext, useContext } from "react";
 2 | 
 3 | /**
 4 |  * A helper to create a Context and Provider with no upfront default value, and
 5 |  * without having to check for undefined all the time.
 6 |  */
 7 | export function createCtx<A extends unknown | null>(errorMsg?: string) {
 8 |   const ctx = createContext<A | undefined>(undefined);
 9 |   function useCtx() {
10 |     const c = useContext(ctx);
11 |     if (c === undefined)
12 |       throw new Error(
13 |         errorMsg ?? "Attempted to call useProfile outside of ProfileProvider"
14 |       );
15 |     return c;
16 |   }
17 |   return [useCtx, ctx.Provider] as const; // 'as const' makes TypeScript infer a tuple
18 | }
19 |

 1 | import { MAPS_API_KEY } from "src/config";
 2 | 
 3 | const isLocalDev = import.meta.env.DEV;
 4 | 
 5 | export const getMapKey = () => {
 6 |   if (MAPS_API_KEY === "<REPLACE-ME>") {
 7 |     console.error(
 8 |       "Add a map provider API key to config.ts or as a site variable to enable map functionality on staging or prod."
 9 |     );
10 |   }
11 | 
12 |   const googleLocalDevKey = { clientKey: "gme-yextinc" };
13 |   const mapboxLocalDevKey = {
14 |     apiKey: "pk.eyJ1IjoieWV4dCIsImEiOiJqNzVybUhnIn0.hTOO5A1yqfpN42-_z_GuLw",
15 |   };
16 | 
17 |   const authObj = isLocalDev ? googleLocalDevKey : { apiKey: MAPS_API_KEY };
18 | 
19 |   return authObj;
20 | };

 86 |             content: `${data.document.yextDisplayCoordinate.lat},${data.document.yextDisplayCoordinate.long}`,
 87 |           },
 88 |         },
 89 |       ]
 90 |     : [];
 91 |   const addressTags: Tag[] = data.document.address
 92 |     ? [
 93 |         {
 94 |           type: "meta",
 95 |           attributes: {
 96 |             name: "geo.placename",
 97 |             content: `${data.document.address.city},${
 98 |               data.document.address.localizedRegionName ||
 99 |               data.document.address.region
100 |             }`,
101 |           },
102 |         },
103 |         {
104 |           type: "meta",
105 |           attributes: {
106 |             name: "geo.region",
107 |             content: `${data.document.address.countryCode}-${data.document.address.region}`,
108 |           },
109 |         },
110 |       ]
111 |     : [];
112 | 
113 |   return {
114 |     title: metaTitle(data),
115 |     charset: "UTF-8",
116 |     viewport: "width=device-width, initial-scale=1, maximum-scale=5",
117 |     tags: [
118 |       {
119 |         type: "meta",
120 |         attributes: {
121 |           name: "description",
122 |           content: metaDescription(data),
123 |         },
124 |       },
125 |       {
126 |         type: "meta",
127 |         attributes: {
128 |           property: "og:title",
129 |           content: metaTitle(data),
130 |         },
131 |       },
132 |       {
133 |         type: "meta",
134 |         attributes: {
135 |           property: "og:description",
136 |           content: metaDescription(data),
137 |         },
138 |       },
139 |       {
140 |         type: "meta",
141 |         attributes: {
142 |           property: "og:url",
143 |           content: canonicalUrl(data),
144 |         },
145 |       },
146 |       {
147 |         type: "link",
148 |         attributes: {
149 |           rel: "canonical",
150 |           href: canonicalUrl(data),
151 |         },
152 |       },
153 |       {
154 |         type: "link",
155 |         attributes: {
156 |           rel: "shortcut icon",
157 |           type: "image/ico",
158 |           href: favicon,
159 |         },
160 |       },
161 |       ...logoTags,
162 |       ...defaultHeadTags,
163 |       ...geoTags,
164 |       ...addressTags,
165 |       ...(additionalTags || []),
166 |     ],
167 |     other: [yaScript(), SchemaBuilder(data), yextEntityData(data)].join("\n"),
168 |   };
169 | }
170 | 
171 | function yaScript(): string {
172 |   return `<script>window.yextAnalyticsEnabled=false;window.enableYextAnalytics=()=>{window.yextAnalyticsEnabled=true}</script>`;
173 | }
174 | 
175 | // Script for passing entity ID to yextension
176 | function yextEntityData(data: TemplateRenderProps): string {
177 |   return `<script id="yext-entity-data" data-entity-id="${data.document.uid}"></script>`;
178 | }
179 | 
180 | function metaTitle(data: TemplateRenderProps): string {
181 |   // 1. Check for meta field on the entity
182 |   const { c_meta: entityMeta } = data.document;
183 |   if (entityMeta?.title) return entityMeta.title;
184 | 
185 |   // if you want to return some hard coded string for specific page types:
186 |   // if (data.document.meta.entityType.id == "location") {
187 |   //   const profile = data.document;
188 |   //   return `${profile.name} at ${profile.address.line1}`;
189 |   // }
190 | 
191 |   return "";
192 | }
193 | 
194 | function metaDescription(data: TemplateRenderProps): string {
195 |   // 1. Check for meta field on the entity
196 |   const { c_meta: entityMeta } = data.document;
197 |   if (entityMeta?.description) return entityMeta.description;
198 | 
199 |   // 2. Check for breadcrumbs
200 |   const { dm_directoryParents_defaultdirectory } = data.document;
201 |   if (dm_directoryParents_defaultdirectory) {
202 |     return `${dm_directoryParents_defaultdirectory
203 |       .map((crumb: { name: string }) => crumb.name)
204 |       .join(", ")}.`;
205 |   }
206 | 
207 |   return "";
208 | }
209 | 
210 | function canonicalUrl(data: TemplateRenderProps): string {
211 |   let pagePath = data.path;
212 | 
213 |   if (pagePath === "index.html") {
214 |     pagePath = "";
215 |   }
216 | 
217 |   return `https://${data.document.siteDomain}/${pagePath}`;
218 | }

 1 | import { formatPhoneNumber, isValidPhoneNumber } from "@yext/phonenumber-util";
 2 | 
 3 | function dedupeStreamFields(allFields: string[]): string[] {
 4 |   return [...new Set(allFields)];
 5 | }
 6 | 
 7 | /** formatPhone shouldn't be used outside transformProps (in src/templates)
 8 |  * unless absolutely necessary because we don't want to include libPhoneNumber client-side
 9 |  *
10 |  * If you are looking to update the format of phones
11 |  * look inside src/templates/index.tsx's transformProps function
12 |  **/
13 | function formatPhone(
14 |   s: string | undefined,
15 |   countryCode: string
16 | ): string | undefined {
17 |   if (s && isValidPhoneNumber(s)) {
18 |     let phone: string | null;
19 | 
20 |     switch (countryCode) {
21 |       case "US":
22 |         // (123) 555-6789
23 |         phone = formatPhoneNumber({
24 |           e164: s,
25 |           format: "(xxx) xxx-xxxx",
26 |         });
27 |         break;
28 |       default:
29 |         // +1 123 555 6789
30 |         phone = formatPhoneNumber({
31 |           e164: s,
32 |           format: "+x xxx xxx xxxx",
33 |         });
34 |     }
35 | 
36 |     return phone || s;
37 |   }
38 | 
39 |   return s;
40 | }
41 | 
42 | const sortDirectoryByAlphabetical = (directoryChildren: any[]) => {
43 |   const sortFn = (p1: any, p2: any) => {
44 |     if (p1.name === p2.name) {
45 |       return 0;
46 |     }
47 |     return p1.name < p2.name ? -1 : 1;
48 |   };
49 | 
50 |   return directoryChildren.sort(sortFn);
51 | };
52 | 
53 | export { dedupeStreamFields, formatPhone, sortDirectoryByAlphabetical };

 1 | import { useState } from "react";
 2 | import { useEffect, useLayoutEffect } from "react";
 3 | import resolveConfig from "tailwindcss/resolveConfig";
 4 | import { getRuntime } from "@yext/pages/util";
 5 | import defaultScreens from "tailwindcss/defaultTheme";
 6 | import tailwindConfig from "../../tailwind.config";
 7 | import type { KeyValuePair } from "tailwindcss/types/config.js";
 8 | 
 9 | const fullConfig = resolveConfig(tailwindConfig);
10 | 
11 | // TODO: get rid of this type cast. The possible types for screens are very flexible, which makes this complicated
12 | const screens: KeyValuePair<string, string> = (fullConfig.theme?.screens ||
13 |   defaultScreens) as KeyValuePair<string, string>;
14 | 
15 | const runtime = getRuntime();
16 | // TODO(bhaines): move to isServerSide helper when that's released in future pagesJS version
17 | const useIsomorphicEffect =
18 |   runtime.name === "node" || runtime.name === "deno"
19 |     ? useEffect
20 |     : useLayoutEffect;
21 | 
22 | export function useBreakpoint(
23 |   // TODO: this should be `keyof typeof screens`, but because types don't exist for the imported file that breaks
24 |   // autocomplete. This is ok as a workaround because while people might tweak the values for the different breakpoints,
25 |   // they're not likely to change the set of available breakpoints
26 |   breakpoint: keyof typeof defaultScreens.screens,
27 |   defaultValue = false
28 | ) {
29 |   const [match, setMatch] = useState(defaultValue);
30 | 
31 |   useIsomorphicEffect(() => {
32 |     if (!(runtime.name === "browser" && "matchMedia" in window))
33 |       return undefined;
34 | 
35 |     const value = screens[breakpoint];
36 |     const query = window.matchMedia(`(min-width: ${value})`);
37 |     const handler = () => {
38 |       if (query.matches !== match) {
39 |         setMatch(query.matches);
40 |       }
41 |     };
42 | 
43 |     handler();
44 |     query.addEventListener("change", handler);
45 |     return () => {
46 |       query.removeEventListener("change", handler);
47 |     };
48 |   });
49 | 
50 |   return match;
51 | }
52 |

 1 | import { useAnalytics } from "@yext/pages-components";
 2 | import { getRuntime } from "@yext/pages/util";
 3 | 
 4 | declare global {
 5 |   interface Window {
 6 |     yextAnalyticsEnabled: boolean;
 7 |     enableYextAnalytics: () => void;
 8 |   }
 9 | }
10 | 
11 | // This provides the window.enableYextAnalytics function so that clients can enable Yext analytics
12 | // after gaining user consent.
13 | // This hook must be called within a descendant of an AnalyticsProvider.
14 | export function useExposeEnableYAFunction() {
15 |   const analytics = useAnalytics();
16 |   if (!analytics) {
17 |     throw new Error(
18 |       "Attempted to enable Analytics outside of AnalyticsProvider"
19 |     );
20 |   }
21 | 
22 |   if (getRuntime().name === "browser") {
23 |     window.enableYextAnalytics = () => {
24 |       window.yextAnalyticsEnabled = true;
25 |       analytics.optIn();
26 |     };
27 | 
28 |     // There's a fallback for window.enableYextAnalytics that sets window.yextAnalyticsEnabled
29 |     // to true in case a third-party script calls it before this code runs.
30 |     // If that has happened, call the real function now.
31 |     if (window.yextAnalyticsEnabled) {
32 |       window.enableYextAnalytics();
33 |     }
34 |   }
35 | }

 1 | import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
 2 | 
 3 | const OPTIONS: IntersectionObserverInit = {
 4 |   root: null,
 5 |   rootMargin: "100px 0px",
 6 |   threshold: 0,
 7 | };
 8 | 
 9 | export function useIfVisible(
10 |   ref: React.RefObject<HTMLElement>,
11 |   options = OPTIONS
12 | ) {
13 |   const [isVisibleOnce, setIsVisibleOnce] = useState(false);
14 | 
15 |   useEffect(() => {
16 |     if (ref.current) {
17 |       const observer = new IntersectionObserver((entries, observer) => {
18 |         entries.forEach((entry) => {
19 |           if (entry.isIntersecting) {
20 |             setIsVisibleOnce(true);
21 |             if (!ref.current) return;
22 |             observer.unobserve(ref.current);
23 |           }
24 |         });
25 |       }, options);
26 |       observer.observe(ref.current);
27 |       return () => {
28 |         observer.disconnect();
29 |       };
30 |     }
31 |   }, [ref, options]);
32 | 
33 |   return isVisibleOnce;
34 | }
35 |

/src/components/README.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | This is where most custom development work should be done.
 2 | 
 3 | Create subfolders that correspond to your features, so that components can be grouped by usage. For example, for a typical location directory you might have subfolders named `common`, `directory`, `location`.
 4 | 
 5 | Within those subfolders, components should be implemented in a file named after the component. For example a Core component would be implemented in `location/Core.tsx`. When appropriate, css should be written in a css file in the same directory as the tsx (`location/Core.css`) for example.
 6 | 
 7 | For example, a project in progress might look something like this:
 8 | 
 9 | ```
10 | components/
11 | ├── common/
12 | │   ├── Header.tsx
13 | │   └── Header.css
14 | └── location/
15 |     ├── About.tsx
16 |     ├── About.css
17 |     ├── Hero.tsx
18 |     └── Hero.css
19 | ```

52 |   const { distanceFromFilter } = result;

55 |     return null;
56 |   }
57 |

14 |   const formateDate = (date: string) =>
15 |     new Date(date).toLocaleDateString(document.locale, {
16 |       month: "long",
17 |       day: "2-digit",
18 |       year: "numeric",
19 |     });
20 | 
21 |   return (
22 |     <div className="py-6 sm:py-4 flex flex-col sm:flex-row border-t-[1px] border-brand-gray-300">
23 |       <div className="sm:basis-1/3 sm:shrink-0">
24 |         <div className="font-bold mb-2">{review.authorName}</div>
25 |         <div>{formateDate(review.reviewDate)}</div>
26 |       </div>
27 |       <div>
28 |         <div className="flex mb-2">
29 |           <span className="font-bold mr-3">{review.rating}</span>
30 |           <ReviewStars rating={review.rating} />
31 |         </div>
32 |         <div>{review.content}</div>
33 |         {review.comments
34 |           ? [0] && (
35 |               <div className="mt-6">
36 |                 <div className="font-bold mb-1">{`Response from ${name}`}</div>
37 |                 <div className="mb-4 sm:mb-2">
38 |                   {formateDate(review.comments[0].commentDate)}
39 |                 </div>
40 |                 <div>{review.comments[0].content}</div>
41 |               </div>
42 |             )
43 |           : null}
44 |       </div>
45 |     </div>
46 |   );
47 | };

49 | export default ReviewCard;

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import { ReactNode } from "react";
 2 | import classNames from "classnames";
 3 | import { useTemplateData } from "src/common/useTemplateData";
 4 | import ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics from "./ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics";
 5 | import { MaybeLink } from "./MaybeLink";
 6 | 
 7 | interface BreadcrumbsPropsDefault {
 8 |   breadcrumbs: Array<{ slug: string; name: string }>;
 9 |   separator?: ReactNode;
10 |   className?: string;
11 | }
12 | 
13 | /*
14 |  * The 'Breadcrumbs' component renders a breadcrumbs style navigation bar
15 |  *
16 |  * @example
17 |  * ```
18 |  * <Breadcrumbs breadcrumbs={defaultTransformer(streamBreadcrumbs)} />
19 |  * ```
20 |  *
21 |  * @param {[{name: string, slug: string}]} breadcrumbs
22 |  *          List of {crumbName, crumbUrl}
23 |  * @param {ReactElement | string} separator
24 |  *          between each breadcrumb - defaults to '/', also accepts any HTML element (<svg>, <img>, etc)
25 |  */
26 | const Breadcrumbs = (props: BreadcrumbsPropsDefault) => {
27 |   const { breadcrumbs, className, separator = "/" } = props;
28 |   const { relativePrefixToRoot } = useTemplateData();
29 | 
30 |   return (
31 |     <ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics name="breadcrumbs">
32 |       {breadcrumbs?.length && (
33 |         <nav className={classNames("my-4", className)} aria-label="Breadcrumb">
34 |           <ol className="flex flex-wrap">
35 |             {breadcrumbs.map(({ name, slug }, idx) => {
36 |               const isLast = idx === breadcrumbs.length - 1;
37 | 
38 |               return (
39 |                 <li key={idx}>
40 |                   <Breadcrumb
41 |                     name={name}
42 |                     slug={isLast ? "" : relativePrefixToRoot + slug}
43 |                     index={idx}
44 |                     {...props}
45 |                   />
46 |                   {!isLast && (
47 |                     <span className="mx-2 text-brand-gray-400">
48 |                       {separator}
49 |                     </span>
50 |                   )}
51 |                 </li>
52 |               );
53 |             })}
54 |           </ol>
55 |         </nav>
56 |       )}
57 |     </ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics>
58 |   );
59 | };
60 | 
61 | interface BreadcrumbProps {
62 |   name: string;
63 |   slug?: string;
64 |   index: number;
65 | }
66 | 
67 | const Breadcrumb = (props: BreadcrumbProps) => {
68 |   const { name, slug } = props;
69 | 
70 |   return (
71 |     <MaybeLink
72 |       className="link-breadcrumbs link-underline"
73 |       href={slug}
74 |       eventName={`link${props.index}`}
75 |     >
76 |       <span>{name}</span>
77 |     </MaybeLink>
78 |   );
79 | };
80 | 
81 | export default Breadcrumbs;
82 |

 1 | import { AnalyticsScopeProvider } from "@yext/pages-components";
 2 | import { ReactNode } from "react";
 3 | import { ErrorBoundary } from "react-error-boundary";
 4 | 
 5 | type ErrorBoundaryWithAnalyticsProps = {
 6 |   name: string;
 7 |   children: ReactNode;
 8 | };
 9 | 
10 | /**
11 |  * Setup an error boundary around a child component to prevent the entire React app from
12 |  * unmounting on an error. Also bundle the AnalyticsScopeProvider for convenience.
13 |  */
14 | const ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics = (props: ErrorBoundaryWithAnalyticsProps) => {
15 |   const handleError = () => {
16 |     // Setup any sentry reporting here.
17 |     console.error(`Error occured in "${props.name}" scope.`);
18 |   };
19 | 
20 |   return (
21 |     <ErrorBoundary onError={handleError} fallback={<></>}>
22 |       <AnalyticsScopeProvider name={props.name}>
23 |         {props.children}
24 |       </AnalyticsScopeProvider>
25 |     </ErrorBoundary>
26 |   );
27 | };
28 | 
29 | export default ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics;
30 |

 1 | import { useState, useRef } from "react";

 6 |

 8 |   question: string;
 9 |   answer: any;
10 | }
11 | 
12 | const FAQ = (props: FAQItem) => {
13 |   const { question, answer } = props;

22 |       } else {

24 |       }
25 |     }
26 |     setIsOpen(!isOpen);
27 |   };
28 | 
29 |   return (
30 |     <div>
31 |       <button
32 |         className="justify-between w-full flex py-4 cursor-pointer font-bold text-lg"
33 |         onClick={faqToggle}
34 |       >
35 |         <div>{question}</div>
36 |         <div>
37 |           <GoChevronDown
38 |             className={c(
39 |               "transition-transform duration-500 text-brand-primary",

42 |             size="1.5em"
43 |           />
44 |         </div>
45 |       </button>
46 |       <div
47 |         ref={faqRef}
48 |         className={classNames(

51 |         )}
52 |       >

  1 | import { ReactNode, useEffect, useState } from "react";
  2 | import { FALLBACK_SEARCH_PATH } from "src/config";
  3 | import { Link, type Coordinate } from "@yext/pages-components";
  4 | import { useTemplateData } from "src/common/useTemplateData";
  5 | import type { LiveAPIProfile, LocationProfile } from "src/types/entities";
  6 | import classNames from "classnames";
  7 | import DirectoryCard from "src/components/cards/DirectoryCard";
  8 | import ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics from "../common/ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics";
  9 | 
 10 | // Configure nearby locations section liveapi params and endpoint
 11 | // For all available params see: https://hitchhikers.yext.com/docs/contentdeliveryapis/legacy/entities#operation/geoSearchEntities
 12 | 
 13 | const getConfig = (api_key: string) => {
 14 |   return {
 15 |     endpoint: "https://liveapi.yext.com/v2/accounts/me/entities/geosearch",
 16 |     params: {
 17 |       api_key,
 18 |       entityTypes: "location",
 19 |       limit: "4",
 20 |       radius: "50",
 21 |       v: "20220927",
 22 |     },
 23 |   };
 24 | };
 25 | 
 26 | const Nearby = () => {
 27 |   const templateData = useTemplateData();
 28 |   const profile = templateData.document as LocationProfile;
 29 |   const nearby = profile.c_nearbySection;
 30 | 
 31 |   // TODO: move API fetching to this template
 32 | 
 33 |   return (
 34 |     <ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics name="neaby">
 35 |       <NearbyLayout
 36 |         title={nearby?.title}
 37 |         linkToLocator={nearby?.linkToLocator}
 38 |         buttonText={nearby?.cta?.label}
 39 |         buttonLink={nearby?.cta?.link}
 40 |         coordinate={profile.yextDisplayCoordinate}
 41 |         id={profile.id}
 42 |       />
 43 |     </ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics>
 44 |   );
 45 | };
 46 | 
 47 | type NearbyLayoutProps = {
 48 |   title?: string;
 49 |   linkToLocator?: boolean;
 50 |   buttonText?: ReactNode;
 51 |   buttonLink?: string;
 52 |   coordinate: Coordinate;
 53 |   id: string;
 54 | };
 55 | 
 56 | const NearbyLayout = (props: NearbyLayoutProps) => {
 57 |   const {
 58 |     title = "Nearby Locations",
 59 |     linkToLocator = true,
 60 |     buttonText = "Find a Location",
 61 |     buttonLink,
 62 |     coordinate,
 63 |     id,
 64 |   } = props;
 65 | 
 66 |   const { document, relativePrefixToRoot } = useTemplateData();
 67 |   const search_path =
 68 |     document?._site?.c_searchPage?.slug || FALLBACK_SEARCH_PATH;
 69 |   const apiKey = YEXT_PUBLIC_NEARBY_SECTION_API_KEY;
 70 | 
 71 |   const [nearbyLocations, setNearbyLocations] = useState<
 72 |     LiveAPIProfile<LocationProfile>[]
 73 |   >([]);
 74 | 
 75 |   useEffect(() => {
 76 |     if (!coordinate || !apiKey) {
 77 |       return;
 78 |     }
 79 | 
 80 |     const config = getConfig(apiKey);
 81 |     const searchParams = new URLSearchParams({
 82 |       ...config.params,
 83 |       location: `${coordinate.latitude},${coordinate.longitude}`,
 84 |       filter: JSON.stringify({ "meta.id": { "!$eq": `${id}` } }),
 85 |     });
 86 | 
 87 |     fetch(`${config.endpoint}?${searchParams.toString()}`)
 88 |       .then((resp) => resp.json())
 89 |       .then((data) => setNearbyLocations(data.response.entities || []))
 90 |       .catch((error) => console.error(error));
 91 |   }, [coordinate, id, apiKey]);
 92 | 
 93 |   const renderLocatorLink = (className?: string) => {
 94 |     return linkToLocator ? (
 95 |       <Link
 96 |         href={buttonLink ?? relativePrefixToRoot + search_path}
 97 |         className={classNames("button button-primary mt-8 sm:mt-0", className)}
 98 |       >
 99 |         {buttonText}
100 |       </Link>
101 |     ) : null;
102 |   };
103 | 
104 |   if (!apiKey) {
105 |     console.error(
106 |       "Add a nearby API key to the .env file or as a site variable to enable the nearby locations component."
107 |     );
108 |   }
109 | 
110 |   return (
111 |     <div className="py-8 sm:py-16">
112 |       <div className="container">
113 |         <div className="flex justify-between items-center mb-8">
114 |           <h2 className="heading heading-head">{title}</h2>
115 |           {renderLocatorLink("hidden sm:flex")}
116 |         </div>
117 |         <ul className="flex flex-wrap -m-4">
118 |           {nearbyLocations.map((location) => (
119 |             <li key={location.meta.id} className="p-4 w-full sm:w-1/2 lg:w-1/4">
120 |               <DirectoryCard profile={location} />
121 |             </li>
122 |           ))}
123 |         </ul>
124 |         {renderLocatorLink("sm:hidden")}
125 |       </div>
126 |     </div>
127 |   );
128 | };
129 | 
130 | export default Nearby;
131 |

  1 | import { useEffect, useState } from "react";
  2 | import ReviewStars from "src/components/entity/ReviewStars";
  3 | import ReviewCard from "src/components/cards/ReviewCard";
  4 | import {
  5 |   CarouselProvider,
  6 |   Slider,
  7 |   Slide,
  8 |   ButtonBack,
  9 |   ButtonNext,
 10 |   Dot,
 11 | } from "pure-react-carousel";
 12 | import { FaArrowLeft, FaArrowRight } from "react-icons/fa";
 13 | import { fetchReviews } from "src/components/entity/utils/fetchReviews";
 14 | import { useTemplateData } from "src/common/useTemplateData";
 15 | import { LocationProfile, ReviewProfile } from "src/types/entities";
 16 | import ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics from "../common/ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics";
 17 | 
 18 | type ReviewsProps = {
 19 |   maxReviews?: number;
 20 |   numReviewsPerPage?: number;
 21 | };
 22 | 
 23 | const Reviews = (props: ReviewsProps) => {
 24 |   const templateData = useTemplateData();
 25 |   const profile = templateData.document as LocationProfile;
 26 |   const reviews = profile.c_reviewsSection;
 27 | 
 28 |   // TODO: move reviews API fetching into this template
 29 | 
 30 |   return (
 31 |     <ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics name="reviews">
 32 |       <ReviewsLayout
 33 |         title={reviews?.title}
 34 |         name={profile.name}
 35 |         entityId={profile.id}
 36 |         maxReviews={props.maxReviews}
 37 |         numReviewsPerPage={props.numReviewsPerPage}
 38 |       />
 39 |     </ErrorBoundaryWithAnalytics>
 40 |   );
 41 | };
 42 | 
 43 | type ReviewsLayoutProps = ReviewsProps & {
 44 |   title?: string;
 45 |   name: string;
 46 |   entityId: string;
 47 | };
 48 | 
 49 | const ReviewsLayout = (props: ReviewsLayoutProps) => {
 50 |   const {
 51 |     title = "Recent Reviews",
 52 |     maxReviews = 12,
 53 |     numReviewsPerPage = 3,
 54 |     name,
 55 |     entityId,
 56 |   } = props;
 57 | 
 58 |   const [reviews, setReviews] = useState<ReviewProfile[]>([]);
 59 |   const apiKey = YEXT_PUBLIC_REVIEWS_API_KEY;
 60 | 
 61 |   useEffect(() => {
 62 |     if (!apiKey) {
 63 |       console.error(
 64 |         "Add a Reviews API key to the .env file or as a site variable to enable the reviews component."
 65 |       );
 66 |       return;
 67 |     }
 68 |     fetchReviews(apiKey, entityId).then((reviews) => {
 69 |       reviews.sort((a, b) => (a.reviewDate < b.reviewDate ? 1 : -1));
 70 |       setReviews(reviews || []);
 71 |     });
 72 |   }, [apiKey, entityId]);
 73 | 
 74 |   const averageRating = +(
 75 |     reviews.reduce((prev, curr) => prev + curr.rating, 0) / reviews.length
 76 |   ).toFixed(2);
 77 | 
 78 |   // Paginate the reviews so that there are {numReviewsPerPage} per page and a maximum of {maxReviews}.
 79 |   // Each page will be a separate slide in the carousel.
 80 |   const slides = new Array(
 81 |     Math.min(
 82 |       Math.ceil(reviews.length / numReviewsPerPage),
 83 |       Math.ceil(maxReviews / numReviewsPerPage)
 84 |     )
 85 |   )
 86 |     .fill(null)
 87 |     .map((_, slideNum) => (
 88 |       <div className="">
 89 |         {reviews.map(
 90 |           (review, idx) =>
 91 |             idx < (slideNum + 1) * numReviewsPerPage &&
 92 |             idx >= slideNum * numReviewsPerPage &&
 93 |             idx < maxReviews && (
 94 |               <ReviewCard key={idx} review={review} name={name} />
 95 |             )
 96 |         )}
 97 |       </div>
 98 |     ));
 99 | 
100 |   if (!reviews.length) {
101 |     return null;
102 |   }
103 | 
104 |   return (
105 |     <div className="py-8 sm:py-16">
106 |       <div className="container">
107 |         <div className="mb-12 sm:mb-16">
108 |           <h2 className="heading heading-sub text-center mb-3">{title}</h2>
109 |           <div className="flex justify-center">
110 |             <span className="font-bold">{averageRating}</span>
111 |             <ReviewStars rating={averageRating} className="mx-3" />
112 |             <span>({reviews.length} reviews)</span>
113 |           </div>
114 |         </div>
115 |         <div>
116 |           <CarouselProvider
117 |             className="relative"
118 |             naturalSlideWidth={100}
119 |             naturalSlideHeight={100}
120 |             totalSlides={slides.length}
121 |             visibleSlides={1}
122 |             isIntrinsicHeight={true}
123 |             currentSlide={0}
124 |           >
125 |             <div className="flex">
126 |               <Slider>
127 |                 {slides.map((slide, idx) => (
128 |                   <Slide index={idx} key={idx} classNameHidden="!h-0">
129 |                     {slide}
130 |                   </Slide>
131 |                 ))}
132 |               </Slider>
133 |             </div>
134 | 
135 |             <div className="flex items-center justify-center mt-8">
136 |               <ButtonBack className="my-auto w-6 h-6 mr-5 text-brand-primary disabled:text-brand-gray-300 disabled:cursor-default">
137 |                 <FaArrowLeft />
138 |               </ButtonBack>
139 |               {slides.map((_, idx) => (
140 |                 <Dot
141 |                   slide={idx}
142 |                   key={idx}
143 |                   className="mx-3 w-8 h-8 disabled:bg-brand-gray-100 disabled:text-brand-primary disabled:cursor-default"
144 |                 >
145 |                   {idx + 1}
146 |                 </Dot>
147 |               ))}
148 |               <ButtonNext className="my-auto w-6 h-6 ml-5 text-brand-primary disabled:text-brand-gray-300 disabled:cursor-default">
149 |                 <FaArrowRight />
150 |               </ButtonNext>
151 |             </div>
152 |           </CarouselProvider>
153 |         </div>
154 |       </div>
155 |     </div>
156 |   );
157 | };
158 | 
159 | export default Reviews;
160 |

 8 |   });

13 |   )
14 |     .then((resp) => resp.json())
15 |     .catch((error) => console.log(error));
16 | 
17 |   return data.response.docs;

 15 | /**
 16 |  * The configuration data for a field value filter option.
 17 |  *
 18 |  * @public
 19 |  */
 20 | export interface FilterOptionConfig {
 21 |   /** The value used to perform filtering. */
 22 |   value: string | number | boolean | NumberRangeValue;
 23 |   /** The type of filtering operation used. Defaults to an equals comparison. */
 24 |   matcher?: Matcher;
 25 |   /** If this particular filter should be selected by default. */
 26 |   selectedByDefault?: boolean;

 33 | /**
 34 |  * Props for the {@link Filters.CheckboxOption}.

 36 |  * @public
 37 |  */
 38 | export interface CheckboxOptionProps extends FilterOptionConfig {

 40 |   customCssClasses?: CheckboxCssClasses;
 41 | }

 43 | /**
 44 |  * The CSS class interface for {@link Filters.CheckboxOption}.
 45 |  *
 46 |  * @public
 47 |  */
 48 | export interface CheckboxCssClasses {
 49 |   input?: string;
 50 |   input___disabled?: string;
 51 |   label?: string;
 52 |   label___disabled?: string;
 53 |   container?: string;
 54 |   optionContainer?: string;
 55 |   tooltipContainer?: string;
 56 |   tooltip?: string;
 57 | }
 58 | 
 59 | const builtInCssClasses: Readonly<CheckboxCssClasses> = {
 60 |   label: "text-neutral text-sm font-normal cursor-pointer",
 61 |   label___disabled: "opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed",
 62 |   input:
 63 |     "w-3.5 h-3.5 form-checkbox cursor-pointer border border-gray-300 rounded-sm text-primary focus:ring-primary",
 64 |   input___disabled: "border-gray-200 bg-gray-50 cursor-not-allowed",
 65 |   container: "flex items-center",
 66 |   optionContainer: "flex items-center space-x-3 peer",
 67 |   tooltipContainer: "invisible peer-hover:visible relative -right-5 -top-5",
 68 |   tooltip:
 69 |     "absolute z-10 left-0 -top-0.5 whitespace-nowrap rounded shadow-lg p-3 text-sm bg-neutral-dark text-white",
 70 | };
 71 | 
 72 | /**
 73 |  * A checkbox component that represents a single FieldValueFilter.
 74 |  *
 75 |  * @public
 76 |  *
 77 |  * @param props - {@link Filters.CheckboxOptionProps}
 78 |  */
 79 | export function CheckboxOption(props: CheckboxOptionProps): JSX.Element | null {
 80 |   const { fieldId, isOptionsDisabled } = useFilterGroupContext();
 81 |   const {
 82 |     value,
 83 |     matcher = Matcher.Equals,
 84 |     selectedByDefault = false,
 85 |     displayName = props.value,
 86 |     resultsCount,
 87 |   } = props;
 88 |   const cssClasses = builtInCssClasses;
 89 |   const optionId = useId();
 90 |   const { selectFilter, filters, applyFilters } = useFiltersContext();
 91 | 
 92 |   const handleClick = useCallback(
 93 |     (checked: boolean) => {
 94 |       selectFilter({
 95 |         matcher,
 96 |         fieldId,
 97 |         value,
 98 |         displayName: typeof displayName === "string" ? displayName : undefined,
 99 |         selected: checked,
100 |       });
101 |       applyFilters();
102 |     },
103 |     [applyFilters, fieldId, displayName, selectFilter, value, matcher]
104 |   );
105 | 
106 |   const handleChange = useCallback(
107 |     (evt: any) => {
108 |       handleClick(evt.target.checked);
109 |     },
110 |     [handleClick]
111 |   );
112 | 
113 |   const optionFilter: FieldValueFilter = useMemo(() => {
114 |     return {
115 |       fieldId,
116 |       matcher,
117 |       value,
118 |     };
119 |   }, [fieldId, value, matcher]);
120 |   const existingStoredFilter = findSelectableFieldValueFilter(
121 |     optionFilter,
122 |     filters
123 |   );
124 | 
125 |   useEffect(() => {
126 |     if (!existingStoredFilter && selectedByDefault) {
127 |       selectFilter({
128 |         ...optionFilter,
129 |         displayName: typeof displayName === "string" ? displayName : undefined,
130 |         selected: true,
131 |       });
132 |     }
133 |   }, [
134 |     displayName,
135 |     selectFilter,
136 |     selectedByDefault,
137 |     existingStoredFilter,
138 |     optionFilter,
139 |   ]);
140 | 
141 |   const isSelected = existingStoredFilter
142 |     ? existingStoredFilter.selected
143 |     : false;
144 | 
145 |   const displayNameString = isNumberRangeValue(displayName)
146 |     ? getDefaultFilterDisplayName(displayName)
147 |     : displayName.toString();
148 | 
149 |   const labelText = resultsCount
150 |     ? `${displayNameString} (${resultsCount})`
151 |     : displayNameString;
152 | 
153 |   const inputClasses = classNames(cssClasses.input, {
154 |     [cssClasses.input___disabled ?? ""]: isOptionsDisabled,
155 |   });
156 |   const labelClasses = classNames(cssClasses.label, {
157 |     [cssClasses.label___disabled ?? ""]: isOptionsDisabled,
158 |   });
159 | 
160 |   return (
161 |     <div className={cssClasses.container}>
162 |       <div className={cssClasses.optionContainer}>
163 |         <input
164 |           type="checkbox"
165 |           id={optionId}
166 |           checked={isSelected}
167 |           className={inputClasses}
168 |           onChange={handleChange}
169 |           disabled={isOptionsDisabled}
170 |         />
171 |         <label className={labelClasses} htmlFor={optionId}>
172 |           {labelText}
173 |         </label>
174 |       </div>
175 |       {isOptionsDisabled && (
176 |         <div className={cssClasses.tooltipContainer}>
177 |           <div className={cssClasses.tooltip}>
178 |             Clear the range to select options.
179 |           </div>
180 |         </div>
181 |       )}
182 |     </div>
183 |   );
184 | }
185 |

  1 | import { FacetsProvider } from "./FacetsProvider";
  2 | import { StandardFacetContent } from "./StandardFacetContent";
  3 | import { FacetProps, FacetsProps } from "./FacetProps";
  4 | import { isNumericalFacet, isStringFacet } from "./filterutils";
  5 | import { FilterDivider } from "./FilterDivider";
  6 | import { Fragment } from "react";
  7 | import { NumericalFacetContent } from "./NumericalFacetContent";
  8 | import { HierarchicalFacetContent } from "./HierarchicalFacetContent";
  9 | import { DisplayableFacet } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
 10 | 
 11 | enum FacetType {
 12 |   STANDARD = "STANDARD",
 13 |   NUMERICAL = "NUMERICAL",
 14 |   HIERARCHICAL = "HIERARCHICAL",
 15 | }
 16 | 
 17 | /**
 18 |  * A component that displays all facets applicable to the current vertical search.
 19 |  *
 20 |  * @remarks
 21 |  * This component is a quick way of getting facets on the page, and it will render standard facets,
 22 |  * numerical facets, and hierarchical facets. The {@link StandardFacet}, {@link NumericalFacet},
 23 |  * and {@link HierarchicalFacet} components can be used to override the default facet configuration.
 24 |  *
 25 |  * @param props - {@link FacetsProps}
 26 |  * @returns A React component for facets
 27 |  *
 28 |  * @public
 29 |  */
 30 | export function Facets(props: FacetsProps) {
 31 |   const {
 32 |     searchOnChange,
 33 |     onlyRenderChildren = false,
 34 |     children,
 35 |     hierarchicalFieldIds = [],
 36 |     excludedFieldIds = [],
 37 |     collapsible,
 38 |     showOptionCounts,
 39 |   } = props;
 40 | 
 41 |   const fieldIdToCustomFacetProps = new Map();
 42 |   const fieldIds: string[] = [];
 43 |   if (children) {
 44 |     (Array.isArray(children) ? children : [children])
 45 |       .filter((child) => child?.props?.fieldId)
 46 |       .forEach((child) => {
 47 |         fieldIdToCustomFacetProps.set(child.props.fieldId, child);
 48 |         fieldIds.push(child.props.fieldId);
 49 |       });
 50 |   }
 51 | 
 52 |   return (
 53 |     <div>
 54 |       <FacetsProvider searchOnChange={searchOnChange}>
 55 |         {(facets) => {
 56 |           if (!facets?.length) {
 57 |             return;
 58 |           }
 59 | 
 60 |           if (!onlyRenderChildren) {
 61 |             facets.forEach((facet) => {
 62 |               if (!fieldIds.includes(facet.fieldId)) {
 63 |                 fieldIds.push(facet.fieldId);
 64 |               }
 65 |             });
 66 |           }
 67 | 
 68 |           const fieldIdToFacet = new Map();
 69 |           facets.forEach((facet) => fieldIdToFacet.set(facet.fieldId, facet));
 70 | 
 71 |           return fieldIds
 72 |             .filter(
 73 |               (fieldId) =>
 74 |                 !excludedFieldIds.includes(fieldId) &&
 75 |                 fieldIdToFacet.get(fieldId).options.length > 0 &&
 76 |                 (!onlyRenderChildren || fieldIdToCustomFacetProps.has(fieldId))
 77 |             )
 78 |             .map((fieldId, i) => {
 79 |               const facet: DisplayableFacet = fieldIdToFacet.get(fieldId);
 80 | 
 81 |               return (
 82 |                 <Fragment key={facet.fieldId}>
 83 |                   <Facet
 84 |                     facet={facet}
 85 |                     hierarchicalFieldIds={hierarchicalFieldIds}
 86 |                     collapsible={collapsible}
 87 |                     showOptionCounts={showOptionCounts}
 88 |                   />
 89 |                   {i < facets.length - 1 && <FilterDivider />}
 90 |                 </Fragment>
 91 |               );
 92 |             });
 93 |         }}
 94 |       </FacetsProvider>
 95 |     </div>
 96 |   );
 97 | }
 98 | 
 99 | /**
100 |  * A component that represents a single facet.
101 |  *
102 |  * @param facet - {@link DisplayableFacet}
103 |  * @param facetsCustomCssClasses - {@link FacetsCssClasses}
104 |  * @param fieldIdToCustomFacetProps - a map of fieldId to facet props
105 |  * @param hierarchicalFieldIds - a list of hierarchical field ids
106 |  * @returns {@link ReactElement}
107 |  *
108 |  * @internal
109 |  */
110 | export function Facet({
111 |   facet,
112 |   hierarchicalFieldIds,
113 |   collapsible,
114 |   showOptionCounts,
115 | }: {
116 |   facet: DisplayableFacet;
117 |   hierarchicalFieldIds: string[];
118 |   collapsible?: boolean;
119 |   showOptionCounts?: boolean;
120 | }) {
121 |   const facetProps: FacetProps = {
122 |     fieldId: facet.fieldId,
123 |     label: facet.displayName,
124 |     collapsible,
125 |     showOptionCounts,
126 |   };
127 |   const facetType = getFacetTypeFromFacet(facet, hierarchicalFieldIds);
128 | 
129 |   switch (facetType) {
130 |     case FacetType.NUMERICAL:
131 |       return <NumericalFacetContent facet={facet} {...facetProps} />;
132 |     case FacetType.HIERARCHICAL:
133 |       return <HierarchicalFacetContent facet={facet} {...facetProps} />;
134 |     case FacetType.STANDARD:
135 |     // fall through
136 |     default:
137 |       return <StandardFacetContent facet={facet} {...facetProps} />;
138 |   }
139 | }
140 | 
141 | /**
142 |  * Returns the type of the facet based on facet.
143 |  * @param facet - {@link DisplayableFacet}
144 |  * @param hierarchicalFieldIds - string
145 |  * @returns {@link FacetType}
146 |  *
147 |  * @internal
148 |  */
149 | export function getFacetTypeFromFacet(
150 |   facet: DisplayableFacet,
151 |   hierarchicalFieldIds: string[] = []
152 | ) {
153 |   if (hierarchicalFieldIds.includes(facet.fieldId)) {
154 |     return FacetType.HIERARCHICAL;
155 |   } else if (isStringFacet(facet)) {
156 |     return FacetType.STANDARD;
157 |   } else if (isNumericalFacet(facet)) {
158 |     return FacetType.NUMERICAL;
159 |   }
160 | 
161 |   return FacetType.STANDARD;
162 | }
163 |

  5 | } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
