  8 | 
  9 | import {
 10 |   getSelectedNumericalFacetFields,
 11 |   isNumberRangeValue,
 12 | } from "./filterutils";
 13 | import { clearStaticRangeFilters } from "./filterutils";
 14 | import { executeSearch } from "./search-operations";
 15 | import { FiltersContext, FiltersContextType } from "./FiltersContext";
 16 | 
 17 | /**
 18 |  * Props for {@link Filters.FacetsProvider}
 19 |  *
 20 |  * @public
 21 |  */
 22 | export interface FacetsProviderProps {
 23 |   /** CSS class names applied to the component's container div. */
 24 |   className?: string;
 25 |   /** Whether or not a search is automatically run when a filter is selected. Defaults to true. */
 26 |   searchOnChange?: boolean;
 27 |   /** A function which renders the Facets UI with the provided facets data.
 28 |    *
 29 |    * @remarks
 30 |    * It is intended to be used with the Filters subcomponents including Filters.FilterGroupProvider,
 31 |    * Filters.CollapsibleLabel, Filters.SearchInput, Filters.CheckboxOption, Filters.CollapsibleSection
 32 |    */
 33 |   children?: (facets: DisplayableFacet[]) => ReactNode;
 34 | }
 35 | 
 36 | /**
 37 |  * The FacetsProvider component is a wrapper component around {@link Filters} that updates facet
 38 |  * options when a child filter is updated.
 39 |  *
 40 |  * The representation of the facets is configured using a FACC (function as a child component)
 41 |  * The FACC is passed the facets data, and is intended for use with components like
 42 |  * {@link Filters.CheckboxOption}.
 43 |  *
 44 |  * @public
 45 |  *
 46 |  * @param props - {@link Filters.FacetsProviderProps}
 47 |  */
 48 | export function FacetsProvider({
 49 |   children,
 50 |   className = "w-full",
 51 |   searchOnChange = true,
 52 | }: FacetsProviderProps): JSX.Element {
 53 |   const searchActions = useSearchActions();
 54 |   const facetsInState = useSearchState((state) => state.filters.facets);
 55 |   const facets = useMemo(() => facetsInState ?? [], [facetsInState]);
 56 |   const filters: SelectableFieldValueFilter[] = useMemo(() => {
 57 |     return facets.flatMap((f) =>
 58 |       f.options.map((o) => {
 59 |         return {
 60 |           fieldId: f.fieldId,
 61 |           value: o.value,
 62 |           matcher: o.matcher,
 63 |           selected: o.selected,
 64 |           displayName: o.displayName,
 65 |         };
 66 |       })
 67 |     );
 68 |   }, [facets]);
 69 | 
 70 |   const filtersContextInstance: FiltersContextType = useMemo(() => {
 71 |     return {
 72 |       selectFilter(filter: SelectableFieldValueFilter) {
 73 |         if (
 74 |           typeof filter.value === "object" &&
 75 |           !isNumberRangeValue(filter.value)
 76 |         ) {
 77 |           console.error(
 78 |             "Facets only support string, number, boolean, and NumberRangeValue. Found the following object value instead:",
 79 |             filter.value
 80 |           );
 81 |           return;
 82 |         }
 83 |         const facetOption = {
 84 |           matcher: filter.matcher,
 85 |           value: filter.value,
 86 |         };
 87 |         searchActions.setFacetOption(
 88 |           filter.fieldId,
 89 |           facetOption,
 90 |           filter.selected
 91 |         );
 92 |       },
 93 |       applyFilters() {
 94 |         if (searchOnChange) {
 95 |           searchActions.setOffset(0);
 96 |           clearStaticRangeFilters(
 97 |             searchActions,
 98 |             getSelectedNumericalFacetFields(searchActions)
 99 |           );
100 |           executeSearch(searchActions);
101 |         }
102 |       },
103 |       filters,
104 |     };
105 |   }, [searchActions, filters, searchOnChange]);
106 | 
107 |   return (
108 |     <div className={className}>
109 |       <FiltersContext.Provider value={filtersContextInstance}>
110 |         {children?.(facets)}
111 |       </FiltersContext.Provider>
112 |     </div>
113 |   );
114 | }

 24 | /**
 25 |  * Props for the FilterGroup component.
 26 |  *
 27 |  * @public
 28 |  */
 29 | export interface FilterGroupProps {
 30 |   /** The fieldId corresponding to the filter group. */
 31 |   fieldId: string;
 32 |   /** {@inheritDoc FilterOptionConfig} */
 33 |   filterOptions: FilterOptionConfig[];
 34 |   /** The displayed label for the filter group. */
 35 |   title: string;
 36 |   /** Whether or not the filter is collapsible. Defaults to true. */
 37 |   collapsible?: boolean;
 38 |   /**
 39 |    * If the filter group is collapsible, whether or not it should start out
 40 |    * expanded. Defaults to true.
 41 |    */
 42 |   defaultExpanded?: boolean;
 43 |   /** Whether or not to display a text input to search for filter options. */
 44 |   searchable?: boolean;

 46 |   customCssClasses?: FilterGroupCssClasses;
 47 |   /** Limit on the number of options to be displayed. */
 48 |   showMoreLimit?: number;

 51 | /**
 52 |  * Renders a group of selectable filters with support for searching and collapsing.
 53 |  */
 54 | export function FilterGroup({
 55 |   fieldId,
 56 |   filterOptions,
 57 |   title,
 58 |   collapsible = true,
 59 |   defaultExpanded = true,
 60 |   searchable,
 61 |   customCssClasses = {},
 62 |   showMoreLimit = filterOptions.length,
 63 |   children,
 64 | }: PropsWithChildren<FilterGroupProps>) {
 65 |   return (
 66 |     <FilterGroupProvider
 67 |       fieldId={fieldId}
 68 |       defaultExpanded={!collapsible || defaultExpanded}
 69 |     >
 70 |       <FacetTitle
 71 |         label={title}
 72 |         customCssClasses={customCssClasses}
 73 |         collapsible={collapsible}
 74 |       />
 75 |       <CollapsibleSection>
 76 |         {searchable && <SearchInput />}
 77 |         <CheckboxOptions
 78 |           filterOptions={filterOptions}
 79 |           showMoreLimit={showMoreLimit}
 80 |         />
 81 |         {children}
 82 |       </CollapsibleSection>
 83 |     </FilterGroupProvider>
 84 |   );
 85 | }
 86 | 
 87 | function CheckboxOptions({
 88 |   filterOptions,
 89 |   showMoreLimit,
 90 | }: {
 91 |   filterOptions: FilterOptionConfig[];
 92 |   showMoreLimit: number;
 93 | }) {
 94 |   const searchUtilities = useSearchUtilities();
 95 |   const { searchValue } = useFilterGroupContext();
 96 | 
 97 |   const shouldRenderOption = (option: FilterOptionConfig) => {
 98 |     return searchUtilities.isCloseMatch(
 99 |       option.displayName || option.value.toString(),
100 |       searchValue
101 |     );
102 |   };
103 | 
104 |   let displayedOptions = filterOptions.filter(shouldRenderOption).map((o) => {
105 |     return <CheckboxOption {...o} key={o.displayName || o.value.toString()} />;
106 |   });
107 | 
108 |   const isLimited = displayedOptions.length > showMoreLimit;
109 | 
110 |   const [showAll, setShowAll] = useState<boolean>(!isLimited);
111 |   displayedOptions = displayedOptions.slice(
112 |     0,
113 |     showAll ? displayedOptions.length : showMoreLimit
114 |   );
115 | 
116 |   return (
117 |     <>
118 |       {displayedOptions}
119 |       {isLimited && (
120 |         <button
121 |           className="text-primary py-1 text-sm"
122 |           onClick={() => setShowAll(!showAll)}
123 |         >
124 |           {showAll ? "Show Less" : "Show More"}
125 |         </button>
126 |       )}
127 |     </>
128 |   );
129 | }

48 |       isExpanded,
49 |       isOptionsDisabled,
50 |       setIsOptionsDisabled,
51 |     };
52 |   }, [
53 |     fieldId,
54 |     getCollapseProps,
55 |     getToggleProps,
56 |     isExpanded,
57 |     searchValue,
58 |     isOptionsDisabled,
59 |   ]);
60 | 
61 |   return (
62 |     <FilterGroupContext.Provider value={FilterGroupContextInstance}>
63 |       {children}
64 |     </FilterGroupContext.Provider>
65 |   );
66 | }

  1 | import { DisplayableFacet } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
  2 | import { ReactNode, useCallback, useState } from "react";
  3 | import {
  4 |   HierarchicalFacetNode,

  7 | } from "./useHierarchicalFacetTree";
  8 | import { useFiltersContext } from "./FiltersContext";
  9 | 
 10 | export const DEFAULT_HIERARCHICAL_DELIMITER = ">";
 11 | 
 12 | /**
 13 |  * Props for HierarchicalFacetDisplay
 14 |  *
 15 |  * @public
 16 |  */
 17 | export interface HierarchicalFacetDisplayProps {
 18 |   /** The `DisplayableFacet` to render as a HierarchicalFacetDisplay. */
 19 |   facet: DisplayableFacet;
 20 |   /** {@inheritDoc HierarchicalFacetsProps.delimiter} */
 21 |   delimiter?: string;
 22 |   /** {@inheritDoc HierarchicalFacetsProps.showMoreLimit} */
 23 |   showMoreLimit?: number;
 24 |   /**
 25 |    * CSS classes for customizing the component styling
 26 |    * of HierarchicalFacetDisplayCssClasses.
 27 |    */
 28 |   customCssClasses?: HierarchicalFacetDisplayCssClasses;
 29 | }

 31 | /**
 32 |  * The CSS class interface for HierarchicalFacetDisplay.
 33 |  *
 34 |  * @public
 35 |  */
 36 | export interface HierarchicalFacetDisplayCssClasses {
 37 |   treeContainer?: string;
 38 |   allCategoriesOption___active?: string;
 39 |   allCategoriesOption___inactive?: string;
 40 |   availableOption__active?: string;
 41 |   availableOption__inactive?: string;
 42 |   parentCategory?: string;
 43 |   currentCategory?: string;
 44 |   showMoreButton?: string;
 45 | }
 46 | 
 47 | const builtInCssClasses: Readonly<HierarchicalFacetDisplayCssClasses> = {
 48 |   treeContainer: "flex flex-col items-start",
 49 |   allCategoriesOption___active: "font-semibold mb-2 text-sm",
 50 |   allCategoriesOption___inactive: "mb-2 text-sm",
 51 |   availableOption__active: "font-semibold ml-4 mb-2 text-sm",
 52 |   availableOption__inactive: "ml-4 mb-2 text-sm",
 53 |   parentCategory: "mb-2 text-sm",
 54 |   currentCategory: "font-semibold mb-2 text-sm",
 55 |   showMoreButton: "ml-4 text-sm font-medium text-primary",
 56 | };
 57 | 
 58 | /**
 59 |  * A HierarchicalFacetDisplay takes a `DisplayableFacet` and renders the facet in a way
 60 |  * to represent multiple levels of "hierarchies".
 61 |  *
 62 |  * The hierarchies are determined by the provided delimiter, which defaults to "\>".
 63 |  *
 64 |  * @public
 65 |  */
 66 | export function HierarchicalFacetDisplay({
 67 |   facet,
 68 |   delimiter = DEFAULT_HIERARCHICAL_DELIMITER,
 69 |   showMoreLimit = 4,
 70 | }: HierarchicalFacetDisplayProps): JSX.Element {
 71 |   const tree = useHierarchicalFacetTree(facet, delimiter);
 72 |   const [isShowingMore, setIsShowingMore] = useState(false);
 73 |   const resetShowMore = useCallback(() => setIsShowingMore(false), []);
 74 |   const toggleShowMore = useCallback(() => {
 75 |     setIsShowingMore(!isShowingMore);
 76 |   }, [isShowingMore]);
 77 | 
 78 |   /** Iteratively parses the `HierarchicalFacetTree` into an array of ReactNodes */
 79 |   function renderTree(): ReactNode[] {
 80 |     let treePointer: HierarchicalFacetTree = tree;
 81 |     const renderedNodesAndShowMoreButton: ReactNode[] = [
 82 |       renderAllCategoriesButton(),
 83 |     ];
 84 | 
 85 |     while (treePointer) {
 86 |       const currentNodes = Object.values(treePointer);
 87 |       const selectedChildNode = currentNodes.find((n) => n.selected);
 88 |       const selectedHasNoChildren =
 89 |         selectedChildNode &&
 90 |         Object.values(selectedChildNode.childTree).length === 0;
 91 |       const activeParentNode = currentNodes.find((n) => n.hasSelectedChild);
 92 | 
 93 |       if ((!selectedChildNode && !activeParentNode) || selectedHasNoChildren) {
 94 |         renderedNodesAndShowMoreButton.push(
 95 |           ...renderAvailableOptions(currentNodes)
 96 |         );
 97 |         if (currentNodes.length > showMoreLimit) {
 98 |           renderedNodesAndShowMoreButton.push(renderShowMoreButton());
 99 |         }
100 |         break;
101 |       }
102 | 
103 |       const activeNode = selectedChildNode ?? activeParentNode;
104 |       if (!activeNode) {
105 |         break;
106 |       }
107 |       renderedNodesAndShowMoreButton.push(
108 |         renderCategory(activeNode, facet.fieldId)
109 |       );
110 |       treePointer = activeNode.childTree;
111 |     }
112 | 
113 |     return renderedNodesAndShowMoreButton;
114 |   }
115 | 
116 |   function renderAllCategoriesButton() {
117 |     return (
118 |       <AllCategories
119 |         key="_AllCategories"
120 |         activeClassName={builtInCssClasses.allCategoriesOption___active}
121 |         inactiveClassName={builtInCssClasses.allCategoriesOption___inactive}
122 |         facet={facet}
123 |         resetShowMore={resetShowMore}
124 |       />
125 |     );
126 |   }
127 | 
128 |   function renderAvailableOptions(nodes: HierarchicalFacetNode[]) {
129 |     const nodesToRender = isShowingMore ? nodes : nodes.slice(0, showMoreLimit);
130 |     return nodesToRender.map((n) => (
131 |       <AvailableOption
132 |         key={n.lastDisplayNameToken}
133 |         activeClassName={builtInCssClasses.availableOption__active}
134 |         inactiveClassName={builtInCssClasses.availableOption__inactive}
135 |         fieldId={facet.fieldId}
136 |         currentNode={n}
137 |         resetShowMore={resetShowMore}
138 |         siblingNodes={nodes.filter((siblingNode) => siblingNode !== n)}
139 |       />
140 |     ));
141 |   }
142 | 
143 |   function renderShowMoreButton() {
144 |     return (
145 |       <ShowMoreButton
146 |         key="_ShowMoreButton"
147 |         className={builtInCssClasses.showMoreButton}
148 |         isShowingMore={isShowingMore}
149 |         toggleShowMore={toggleShowMore}
150 |       />
151 |     );
152 |   }
153 | 
154 |   function renderCategory(
155 |     selectedNode: HierarchicalFacetNode,
156 |     fieldId: string
157 |   ) {
158 |     const sharedProps = {
159 |       key: selectedNode.lastDisplayNameToken,
160 |       resetShowMore,
161 |       selectedNode,
162 |       fieldId,
163 |     };
164 | 
165 |     if (selectedNode.hasSelectedChild) {
166 |       return (
167 |         <ParentCategory
168 |           className={builtInCssClasses.parentCategory}
169 |           {...sharedProps}
170 |         />
171 |       );
172 |     } else {
173 |       return (
174 |         <CurrentCategory
175 |           className={builtInCssClasses.currentCategory}
176 |           {...sharedProps}
177 |         />
178 |       );
179 |     }
180 |   }
181 | 
182 |   return <div className={builtInCssClasses.treeContainer}>{renderTree()}</div>;
183 | }
184 | 
185 | /**
186 |  * A hard-coded "All Categories" button that can be used to reset the HierarchicalFacetDisplay
187 |  * to its initial state, i.e. with no options selected.
188 |  */
189 | function AllCategories({
190 |   facet,
191 |   inactiveClassName,
192 |   activeClassName,
193 |   resetShowMore,
194 | }: {
195 |   facet: DisplayableFacet;
196 |   activeClassName?: string;
197 |   inactiveClassName?: string;
198 |   resetShowMore: () => void;
199 | }) {
200 |   const { applyFilters, selectFilter } = useFiltersContext();
201 |   const handleClickAllCategories = useCallback(() => {
202 |     facet.options
203 |       .filter((o) => o.selected)
204 |       .forEach((o) =>
205 |         selectFilter({ ...o, fieldId: facet.fieldId, selected: false })
206 |       );
207 |     applyFilters();
208 |     resetShowMore();
209 |   }, [applyFilters, facet.fieldId, facet.options, resetShowMore, selectFilter]);
210 | 
211 |   if (facet.options.find((o) => o.selected)) {
212 |     return (
213 |       <button className={inactiveClassName} onClick={handleClickAllCategories}>
214 |         All Categories /
215 |       </button>
216 |     );
217 |   }
218 | 
219 |   return <div className={activeClassName}>All Categories</div>;
220 | }
221 | 
222 | /** An option currently available for selection or deselection. */
223 | function AvailableOption(props: {
224 |   fieldId: string;
225 |   activeClassName?: string;
226 |   inactiveClassName?: string;
227 |   resetShowMore: () => void;
228 |   currentNode: HierarchicalFacetNode;
229 |   siblingNodes: HierarchicalFacetNode[];
230 | }) {
231 |   const {
232 |     fieldId,
233 |     currentNode,
234 |     activeClassName,
235 |     inactiveClassName,
236 |     resetShowMore,
237 |     siblingNodes,
238 |   } = props;
239 |   const { applyFilters, selectFilter } = useFiltersContext();
240 |   const { selected, lastDisplayNameToken, facetOption } = currentNode;
241 |   const handleClickAvailableOptions = useCallback(() => {
242 |     siblingNodes
243 |       .filter((n) => n.selected)
244 |       .forEach((n) =>
245 |         selectFilter({
246 |           ...n.facetOption,
247 |           selected: false,
248 |           fieldId,
249 |         })
250 |       );
251 |     selectFilter({
252 |       ...facetOption,
253 |       selected: !selected,
254 |       fieldId,
255 |     });
256 |     const parentFacetOption = currentNode.parentNode?.facetOption;
257 |     parentFacetOption &&
258 |       selectFilter({
259 |         ...parentFacetOption,
260 |         selected,
261 |         fieldId,
262 |       });
263 |     applyFilters();
264 |     resetShowMore();
265 |   }, [
266 |     applyFilters,
267 |     currentNode.parentNode?.facetOption,
268 |     facetOption,
269 |     fieldId,
270 |     resetShowMore,
271 |     selectFilter,
272 |     selected,
273 |     siblingNodes,
274 |   ]);
275 | 
276 |   return (
277 |     <button
278 |       className={selected ? activeClassName : inactiveClassName}
279 |       onClick={handleClickAvailableOptions}
280 |     >
281 |       {lastDisplayNameToken}
282 |     </button>
283 |   );
284 | }
285 | 
286 | /** A parent category that is not the most immediate one. */
287 | function ParentCategory({
288 |   fieldId,
289 |   selectedNode,
290 |   className,
291 |   resetShowMore,
292 | }: {
293 |   fieldId: string;
294 |   selectedNode: HierarchicalFacetNode;
295 |   className?: string;
296 |   resetShowMore: () => void;
297 | }) {
298 |   const { applyFilters, selectFilter } = useFiltersContext();
299 | 
300 |   const deselectChildOptions = useCallback(
301 |     (node: HierarchicalFacetNode) => {
302 |       const tree = node.childTree;
303 |       Object.values(tree).forEach((n) => {
304 |         selectFilter({
305 |           ...n.facetOption,
306 |           selected: false,
307 |           fieldId,
308 |         });
309 |         deselectChildOptions(n);
310 |       });
311 |     },
312 |     [fieldId, selectFilter]
313 |   );
314 | 
315 |   const handleClickParentCategory = useCallback(() => {
316 |     selectFilter({
317 |       ...selectedNode.facetOption,
318 |       selected: true,
319 |       fieldId,
320 |     });
321 |     deselectChildOptions(selectedNode);
322 |     applyFilters();
323 |     resetShowMore();
324 |   }, [
325 |     applyFilters,
326 |     deselectChildOptions,
327 |     fieldId,
328 |     resetShowMore,
329 |     selectFilter,
330 |     selectedNode,
331 |   ]);
332 | 
333 |   return (
334 |     <button className={className} onClick={handleClickParentCategory}>
335 |       {selectedNode.lastDisplayNameToken + " /"}
336 |     </button>
337 |   );
338 | }
339 | 
340 | /** The currently selected category, i.e. the most immediate category. */
341 | function CurrentCategory({
342 |   fieldId,
343 |   selectedNode,
344 |   className,
345 |   resetShowMore,
346 | }: {
347 |   fieldId: string;
348 |   selectedNode: HierarchicalFacetNode;
349 |   className?: string;
350 |   resetShowMore: () => void;
351 | }) {
352 |   const { applyFilters, selectFilter } = useFiltersContext();
353 |   const handleClickCurrentCategory = useCallback(() => {
354 |     selectFilter({
355 |       ...selectedNode.facetOption,
356 |       selected: false,
357 |       fieldId,
358 |     });
359 |     const parentFacetOption = selectedNode.parentNode?.facetOption;
360 |     parentFacetOption &&
361 |       selectFilter({
362 |         ...parentFacetOption,
363 |         selected: true,
364 |         fieldId,
365 |       });
366 |     applyFilters();
367 |     resetShowMore();
368 |   }, [
369 |     applyFilters,
370 |     fieldId,
371 |     resetShowMore,
372 |     selectFilter,
373 |     selectedNode.facetOption,
374 |     selectedNode.parentNode?.facetOption,
375 |   ]);
376 | 
377 |   return (
378 |     <button className={className} onClick={handleClickCurrentCategory}>
379 |       {selectedNode.lastDisplayNameToken}
380 |     </button>
381 |   );
382 | }
383 | 
384 | /** The "Show more/less" button for hiding/showing additional `AvailableOption`s */
385 | function ShowMoreButton({
386 |   className,
387 |   isShowingMore,
388 |   toggleShowMore,
389 | }: {
390 |   className?: string;
391 |   isShowingMore: boolean;
392 |   toggleShowMore: () => void;
393 | }) {
394 |   return (
395 |     <button className={className} onClick={toggleShowMore}>
396 |       {isShowingMore ? "Show less" : "Show more"}
397 |     </button>
398 |   );
399 | }
400 |

109 |   const [minRangeInput, setMinRangeInput] = useState<string>("");
110 |   const [maxRangeInput, setMaxRangeInput] = useState<string>("");
111 |   const staticFilters = useSearchState((state) => state.filters.static);
112 |   const fieldValueFilters = useMemo(
113 |     () => getSelectableFieldValueFilters(staticFilters ?? []),
114 |     [staticFilters]
115 |   );
116 |   const isDisabled = filters.some(
117 |     (filter) => filter.selected && filter.fieldId === fieldId
118 |   );
119 | 
120 |   const rangeFilter = useMemo(() => {
121 |     return {
122 |       kind: "fieldValue" as const,
123 |       fieldId,
124 |       matcher: Matcher.Between,
125 |       value: parseNumberRangeInput(minRangeInput, maxRangeInput),
126 |     };
127 |   }, [fieldId, maxRangeInput, minRangeInput]);
128 | 
129 |   const isValid = isValidRange(rangeFilter.value);
130 | 
131 |   // Find a static filter which matches the current range input
132 |   const matchingFilter = findSelectableFieldValueFilter(
133 |     rangeFilter,
134 |     fieldValueFilters
135 |   );
136 |   const isSelectedInAnswersState = matchingFilter?.selected === true;
137 |   const hasUserInput = !!(minRangeInput || maxRangeInput);
138 |   const shouldRenderApplyButton = hasUserInput && !isSelectedInAnswersState;
139 | 
140 |   useEffect(() => {
141 |     setIsOptionsDisabled(hasUserInput);
142 |   }, [hasUserInput, setIsOptionsDisabled]);
143 | 
144 |   const handleMinChange = useCallback((event: any) => {
145 |     const input = event?.target?.value;
146 |     validateNumericInput(input) && setMinRangeInput(input);
147 |   }, []);
148 | 
149 |   const handleMaxChange = useCallback((event: any) => {
150 |     const input = event?.target?.value;
151 |     validateNumericInput(input) && setMaxRangeInput(input);
152 |   }, []);
153 | 
154 |   const handleClickApply = useCallback(() => {
155 |     if (!rangeFilter.value.start && !rangeFilter.value.end) {
156 |       return;
157 |     }
158 |     if (!isValid) {
159 |       return;
160 |     }
161 |     const displayName = getFilterDisplayName(rangeFilter.value);
162 |     clearStaticRangeFilters(searchActions, new Set([fieldId]));
163 |     searchActions.setFilterOption({
164 |       filter: rangeFilter,
165 |       selected: true,
166 |       displayName,
167 |     });
168 |     searchActions.setOffset(0);
169 |     executeSearch(searchActions);
170 |   }, [searchActions, fieldId, getFilterDisplayName, isValid, rangeFilter]);
171 | 
172 |   const handleClickClear = useCallback(() => {
173 |     const displayName = getFilterDisplayName(rangeFilter.value);
174 |     searchActions.setFilterOption({
175 |       filter: rangeFilter,
176 |       selected: false,
177 |       displayName,
178 |     });
179 |     setMinRangeInput("");
180 |     setMaxRangeInput("");
181 |     searchActions.setOffset(0);
182 |     executeSearch(searchActions);
183 |   }, [searchActions, getFilterDisplayName, rangeFilter]);
184 | 
185 |   const inputClasses = classNames(cssClasses.input, {
186 |     [cssClasses.input___withPrefix ?? ""]: !!inputPrefix,
187 |     [cssClasses.input___withoutPrefix ?? ""]: !inputPrefix,
188 |     [cssClasses.input___disabled ?? ""]: isDisabled,
189 |     [cssClasses.input___enabled ?? ""]: !isDisabled,
190 |     [cssClasses.input___invalid ?? ""]: !isValid,
191 |     [cssClasses.input___valid ?? ""]: isValid,
192 |   });
193 | 
194 |   const inputPrefixClasses = classNames(cssClasses.inputPrefix, {
195 |     [cssClasses.inputPrefix___disabled ?? ""]: isDisabled,
196 |     [cssClasses.inputPrefix___enabled ?? ""]: !isDisabled,
197 |   });
198 | 
199 |   function renderInput(
200 |     value: string,
201 |     onChange: (event: unknown) => void,
202 |     placeholder: string
203 |   ) {
204 |     return (
205 |       <div className={cssClasses.inputContainer}>
206 |         {inputPrefix && (
207 |           <span className={inputPrefixClasses} aria-hidden="true">
208 |             {inputPrefix}
209 |           </span>
210 |         )}
211 |         <input
212 |           type="text"
213 |           inputMode="decimal"
214 |           value={value}
215 |           placeholder={placeholder}
216 |           disabled={isDisabled}
217 |           className={inputClasses}
218 |           onChange={onChange}
219 |         />
220 |       </div>
221 |     );
222 |   }
223 | 
224 |   return (
225 |     <div className={cssClasses.rangeInputContainer}>
226 |       <div className={cssClasses.inputRowContainer}>
227 |         {renderInput(minRangeInput, handleMinChange, "Min")}
228 |         <div className="w-2.5 text-sm text-neutral">-</div>
229 |         {renderInput(maxRangeInput, handleMaxChange, "Max")}
230 |         {isDisabled && (
231 |           <div className={cssClasses.tooltipContainer}>
232 |             <div className={cssClasses.tooltip}>
233 |               Unselect an option to enter in a range.
234 |             </div>
235 |           </div>
236 |         )}
237 |       </div>
238 |       {!isValid && (
239 |         <div className={cssClasses.invalidRowContainer}>
240 |           <InvalidIcon />
241 |           <div className={cssClasses.invalidMessage}>Invalid range</div>
242 |         </div>
243 |       )}
244 |       {hasUserInput && (
245 |         <div className={cssClasses.buttonsContainer}>
246 |           <button className={cssClasses.clearButton} onClick={handleClickClear}>
247 |             Clear min and max
248 |           </button>
249 |           {shouldRenderApplyButton && (
250 |             <button
251 |               className={cssClasses.applyButton}
252 |               onClick={handleClickApply}
253 |             >
254 |               Apply
255 |             </button>
256 |           )}
257 |         </div>
258 |       )}
259 |     </div>
260 |   );
261 | }
262 | 
263 | /**
264 |  * Creates the filter's display name based on the number range.
265 |  */
266 | function getDefaultFilterDisplayName(numberRange: NumberRangeValue) {
267 |   const start = numberRange.start;
268 |   const end = numberRange.end;
269 | 
270 |   if (start && end) {
271 |     return `${start.value} - ${end.value}`;
272 |   } else if (start && !end) {
273 |     return `Over ${start.value}`;
274 |   } else if (end && !start) {
275 |     return `Up to ${end.value}`;
276 |   }
277 |   return "";
278 | }
279 | 
280 | /**
281 |  * Returns true only if the provided string passes the numeric validation.
282 |  *
283 |  * @remarks
284 |  * Allows whole numbers and numbers with a single period.
285 |  */
286 | function validateNumericInput(str: string) {
287 |   const numberRegex = new RegExp(/^\d*\.?\d*$/);
288 |   return numberRegex.test(str);
289 | }
290 | 
291 | /**
292 |  * Determines if the range is valid.
293 |  */
294 | function isValidRange(range: NumberRangeValue): boolean {
295 |   if (range.start && range.end) {
296 |     return range.start.value <= range.end.value;
297 |   }
298 |   return true;
299 | }

 14 | /**
 15 |  * Check if the object follows NearFilterValue interface.
 16 |  */
 17 | export function isNearFilterValue(obj: unknown): obj is NearFilterValue {
 18 |   return (
 19 |     typeof obj === "object" &&
 20 |     !!obj &&
 21 |     "radius" in obj &&
 22 |     "lat" in obj &&
 23 |     "long" in obj
 24 |   );

 26 | 
 27 | /**
 28 |  * Checks if the object follows the NumberRangeValue interface.
 29 |  */
 30 | export function isNumberRangeValue(obj: unknown): obj is NumberRangeValue {
 31 |   return typeof obj === "object" && !!obj && ("start" in obj || "end" in obj);
 32 | }

 34 | /**
 35 |  * Checks if the facet is a string facet with string options.
 36 |  */
 37 | export function isStringFacet(facet: DisplayableFacet): boolean {
 38 |   return facet.options.length > 0 && typeof facet.options[0].value === "string";
 39 | }
 40 | 
 41 | /**
 42 |  * Checks if the facet is a numerical facet with number range filter options.
 43 |  */
 44 | export function isNumericalFacet(facet: DisplayableFacet): boolean {
 45 |   return (
 46 |     facet.options.length > 0 &&
 47 |     facet.options.some((option) => isNumberRangeFilter(option))
 48 |   );
 49 | }
 50 | 
 51 | /**
 52 |  * Returns true if the two given field value filters are the same.
 53 |  */
 54 | export function isDuplicateFieldValueFilter(
 55 |   thisFilter: FieldValueFilter,
 56 |   otherFilter: FieldValueFilter
 57 | ): boolean {
 58 |   if (thisFilter.fieldId !== otherFilter.fieldId) {
 59 |     return false;
 60 |   }
 61 |   if (thisFilter.matcher !== otherFilter.matcher) {
 62 |     return false;
 63 |   }
 64 |   if (JSON.stringify(thisFilter.value) !== JSON.stringify(otherFilter.value)) {
 65 |     return false;
 66 |   }
 67 |   return true;
 68 | }
 69 | 
 70 | /**
 71 |  * Returns true if the two given static filters are the same.
 72 |  */
 73 | export function isDuplicateStaticFilter(
 74 |   thisFilter: StaticFilter,
 75 |   otherFilter: StaticFilter
 76 | ): boolean {
 77 |   if (thisFilter.kind === "fieldValue") {
 78 |     return otherFilter.kind === "fieldValue"
 79 |       ? isDuplicateFieldValueFilter(thisFilter, otherFilter)
 80 |       : false;
 81 |   }
 82 | 
 83 |   if (otherFilter.kind === "fieldValue") {
 84 |     return false;
 85 |   }
 86 | 
 87 |   return (
 88 |     thisFilter.combinator === otherFilter.combinator &&
 89 |     thisFilter.filters.length === otherFilter.filters.length &&
 90 |     thisFilter.filters.every((t) =>
 91 |       otherFilter.filters.some((o) => isDuplicateStaticFilter(t, o))
 92 |     ) &&
 93 |     otherFilter.filters.every((o) =>
 94 |       thisFilter.filters.some((t) => isDuplicateStaticFilter(o, t))
 95 |     )
 96 |   );
 97 | }
 98 | 
 99 | /**
100 |  * Finds the {@link SelectableFieldValueFilter} from the list provided that matches
101 |  * the given {@link FieldValueFilter}. If no matching {@link SelectableFieldValueFilter}
102 |  * can be found, undefined is returned.
103 |  *
104 |  * @param filter - The filter to match against
105 |  * @param selectableFilters - The list of {@link SelectableFieldValueFilter}s to search against
106 |  */
107 | export function findSelectableFieldValueFilter(
108 |   filter: FieldValueFilter,
109 |   selectableFilters: SelectableFieldValueFilter[]
110 | ): SelectableFieldValueFilter | undefined {
111 |   return selectableFilters.find((selectableFilter) => {
112 |     const { displayName: _, ...storedFilter } = selectableFilter;
113 |     return isDuplicateFieldValueFilter(storedFilter, filter);
114 |   });
115 | }
116 | 
117 | /**
118 |  * Creates a number range value based on a min and max from user input.
119 |  */
120 | export function parseNumberRangeInput(
121 |   minRangeInput: string,
122 |   maxRangeInput: string
123 | ): NumberRangeValue {
124 |   const minRange = parseNumber(minRangeInput);
125 |   const maxRange = parseNumber(maxRangeInput);
126 | 
127 |   return {
128 |     ...(minRange !== undefined && {
129 |       start: {
130 |         matcher: Matcher.GreaterThanOrEqualTo,
131 |         value: minRange,
132 |       },
133 |     }),
134 |     ...(maxRange !== undefined && {
135 |       end: {
136 |         matcher: Matcher.LessThanOrEqualTo,
137 |         value: maxRange,
138 |       },
139 |     }),
140 |   };
141 | }
142 | 
143 | /**
144 |  * Given a string, returns the corresponding number, or undefined if it is NaN.
145 |  */
146 | function parseNumber(num: string) {
147 |   const parsedNum = parseFloat(num);
148 |   if (isNaN(parsedNum)) {
149 |     return undefined;
150 |   }
151 |   return parsedNum;
152 | }
153 | 
154 | /**
155 |  * Deselects the selected static number range filters in state. If fieldIds are
156 |  * provided, only filters corresponding to one of those fieldIds are deselected.
157 |  * Otherwise, all selected filters are deselected.
158 |  */
159 | export function clearStaticRangeFilters(
160 |   searchActions: SearchActions,
161 |   fieldIds?: Set<string>
162 | ) {
163 |   const selectedStaticRangeFilters =
164 |     searchActions.state?.filters?.static?.filter(
165 |       (filter) =>
166 |         isNumberRangeFilter(filter) &&
167 |         filter.selected === true &&
168 |         (!fieldIds || fieldIds.has(filter.fieldId))
169 |     );
170 |   selectedStaticRangeFilters?.forEach((filter) => {
171 |     searchActions.setFilterOption({
172 |       ...filter,
173 |       selected: false,
174 |     });
175 |   });
176 | }
177 | 
178 | /**
179 |  * Returns a set of fieldIds of the numerical facets in state that have at
180 |  * least one option selected.
181 |  */
182 | export function getSelectedNumericalFacetFields(
183 |   searchActions: SearchActions
184 | ): Set<string> {
185 |   const selectedNumericalFacets =
186 |     searchActions.state.filters.facets?.filter(
187 |       (f) => isNumericalFacet(f) && f.options.some((o) => o.selected)
188 |     ) ?? [];
189 |   return new Set(selectedNumericalFacets.map((f) => f.fieldId));
190 | }
191 | 
192 | /**
193 |  * Goes through the provided static filters and returns all that are field value
194 |  * filters.
195 |  *
196 |  * @param staticFilters - The list of {@link SelectableStaticFilter}s to search through
197 |  * @returns All filters that are {@link SelectableFieldValueFilter}s
198 |  */
199 | export function getSelectableFieldValueFilters(
200 |   staticFilters: SelectableStaticFilter[]
201 | ): SelectableFieldValueFilter[] {
202 |   return staticFilters
203 |     .map((s) => {
204 |       const {
205 |         filter: { kind, ...filterFields },
206 |         ...displayFields
207 |       } = s;
208 |       if (kind === "fieldValue") {
209 |         return {
210 |           ...displayFields,
211 |           ...filterFields,
212 |         };
213 |       }
214 |       return undefined;
215 |     })
216 |     .filter((s): s is SelectableFieldValueFilter => !!s);
217 | }

230 |   } else if (end && !start) {

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import { DisplayableFacet, FacetOption } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
 2 | import { useMemo } from "react";
 3 | 
 4 | /**
 5 |  * A tree of `HierarchicalFacetNode`s
 6 |  */
 7 | export type HierarchicalFacetTree = {
 8 |   [key: string]: HierarchicalFacetNode;
 9 | };
10 | 
11 | /**
12 |  * A single node of a `HierarchicalFacetTree`
13 |  */
14 | export type HierarchicalFacetNode = {
15 |   selected: boolean;
16 |   hasSelectedChild: boolean;
17 |   facetOption: FacetOption;
18 |   childTree: HierarchicalFacetTree;
19 |   parentNode?: HierarchicalFacetNode;
20 |   displayNameTokens: string[];
21 |   lastDisplayNameToken: string;
22 | };
23 | 
24 | /**
25 |  * Parses a `DisplayableFacet` into a `HierarchicalFacetTree`, then memoizes it.
26 |  */
27 | export function useHierarchicalFacetTree(
28 |   hierarchicalFacet: DisplayableFacet,
29 |   delimiter: string
30 | ): HierarchicalFacetTree {
31 |   return useMemo(() => {
32 |     return parseHierarchicalFacetTree(hierarchicalFacet, delimiter);
33 |   }, [delimiter, hierarchicalFacet]);
34 | }
35 | 
36 | /**
37 |  * Parses a `DisplayableFacet` into a `HierarchicalFacetTree`.
38 |  */
39 | export function parseHierarchicalFacetTree(
40 |   hierarchicalFacet: DisplayableFacet,
41 |   delimiter: string
42 | ): HierarchicalFacetTree {
43 |   const optionsInAscendingLength =
44 |     hierarchicalFacet?.options
45 |       .map((o) => {
46 |         const displayNameTokens = o.displayName
47 |           .split(delimiter)
48 |           .map((s) => s.trim());
49 |         return {
50 |           ...o,
51 |           displayNameTokens,
52 |         };
53 |       })
54 |       .sort(
55 |         (a, b) => a.displayNameTokens.length - b.displayNameTokens.length
56 |       ) || [];
57 | 
58 |   const tree: HierarchicalFacetTree = {};
59 | 
60 |   optionsInAscendingLength.forEach((o) => {
61 |     const { displayNameTokens, displayName } = o;
62 | 
63 |     let currentTree: HierarchicalFacetTree = tree;
64 |     let parentNode: HierarchicalFacetNode | undefined = undefined;
65 | 
66 |     for (const token of displayNameTokens.slice(0, -1)) {
67 |       if (!(token in currentTree)) {
68 |         console.error(
69 |           `Error parsing hierarchical facet option "${displayName}" at token "${token}". Current tree:`,
70 |           JSON.stringify(tree)
71 |         );
72 |         return;
73 |       }
74 |       if (o.selected) {
75 |         currentTree[token].hasSelectedChild = true;
76 |       }
77 |       parentNode = currentTree[token];
78 |       currentTree = currentTree[token].childTree;
79 |     }
80 | 
81 |     const lastDisplayNameToken =
82 |       displayNameTokens[displayNameTokens.length - 1];
83 |     currentTree[lastDisplayNameToken] = {
84 |       selected: o.selected,
85 |       displayNameTokens,
86 |       lastDisplayNameToken,
87 |       facetOption: {
88 |         value: o.value,
89 |         matcher: o.matcher,
90 |       },
91 |       hasSelectedChild: false,
92 |       childTree: {},
93 |       parentNode: parentNode,
94 |     };
95 |   });
96 | 
97 |   return tree;
98 | }
99 |

 1 | import { useState } from "react";
 2 | import { useSearchActions, Matcher } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
 3 | import type { SelectableStaticFilter } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
 4 | import { executeSearch, getUserLocation } from "@yext/search-ui-react";
 5 | import LoadingSpinner from "src/components/common/LoadingSpinner";
 6 | import { GEOLOCATE_RADIUS } from "src/config";
 7 | import { encodeStaticFilters } from "src/components/search/utils/filterEncodings";
 8 | 
 9 | interface GeolocateButtonProps {
10 |   className?: string;
11 |   redirectToSearchPage?: boolean;
12 |   searcherPath?: string;
13 | }
14 | 
15 | const GeolocateButton = (props: GeolocateButtonProps) => {
16 |   const { className, redirectToSearchPage, searcherPath } = props;
17 | 
18 |   const searchActions = useSearchActions();
19 |   const [isFetchingLocation, setIsFetchingLocation] = useState<boolean>(false);
20 | 
21 |   async function handleGeolocationClick() {
22 |     setIsFetchingLocation(true);
23 |     try {
24 |       const position = await getUserLocation();
25 | 
26 |       // Set userlocation bias
27 |       searchActions.setUserLocation({
28 |         latitude: position.coords.latitude,
29 |         longitude: position.coords.longitude,
30 |       });
31 | 
32 |       const newFilter: SelectableStaticFilter = {
33 |         displayName: "My Location",
34 |         selected: true,
35 |         filter: {
36 |           kind: "fieldValue",
37 |           fieldId: "builtin.location",
38 |           matcher: Matcher.Near,
39 |           value: {
40 |             lat: position.coords.latitude,
41 |             lng: position.coords.longitude,
42 |             radius: 1609 * GEOLOCATE_RADIUS,
43 |           },
44 |         },
45 |       };
46 | 
47 |       searchActions.setStaticFilters([newFilter]);
48 |       searchActions.setOffset(0);
49 |       searchActions.resetFacets();
50 |       await executeSearch(searchActions);
51 | 
52 |       // Redirect to another page with the url params filled out.
53 |       if (redirectToSearchPage && searcherPath) {
54 |         const searchParams = encodeStaticFilters([newFilter]);
55 |         if (searchParams) {
56 |           window.location.href = `${searcherPath}?${searchParams.toString()}`;
57 |         }
58 |       }
59 |     } catch (e) {
60 |       alert("User location could not be determined.");
61 |       console.error(e);
62 |     } finally {
63 |       setIsFetchingLocation(false);
64 |     }
65 |   }
66 | 
67 |   return (
68 |     <>
69 |       <button className={className} onClick={handleGeolocationClick}>
70 |         <svg
71 |           fill="none"
72 |           height="16"
73 |           viewBox="0 0 16 16"
74 |           width="16"
75 |           xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
76 |         >
77 |           <path
78 |             d="m14.4347 0c-.1791 0-.3622.034375-.5435.11l-12.99279 5.99656c-1.499063.69969-.999375 2.89844.59969 2.89844h5.49718v5.4972c0 .9378.75657 1.4978 1.52313 1.4978.54062 0 1.08594-.2781 1.37531-.8981l5.99688-12.99315c.4241-1.01844-.4484-2.10875-1.4559-2.10875zm.5484 1.69-5.99532 12.9894c-.09937.2131-.2575.3212-.46968.3212-.18125 0-.52375-.104-.52375-.4981v-6.49688h-6.49625c-.35782 0-.4575-.27593-.48407-.39468-.03437-.15406-.039683-.43688.30313-.59688l12.95874-5.98156c.0534-.02219.1053-.032813.1591-.032813.1693 0 .359.114063.4722.283753.0684.10281.135.26281.0759.40656z"
79 |             fill="#0f70f0"
80 |           />
81 |         </svg>
82 |         <span className="sr-only">Geolocate.</span>
83 |       </button>
84 |       {isFetchingLocation && <LoadingSpinner />}
85 |     </>
86 |   );
87 | };
88 | 
89 | export default GeolocateButton;

  1 | import { useCallback, useEffect, useState } from "react";
  2 | import { useSearchActions, useSearchState } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
  3 | import { Map, GoogleMaps } from "@yext/pages-components";
  4 | import { useBreakpoint } from "src/common/useBreakpoints";
  5 | import {
  6 |   useLoadInitialSearchParams,
  7 |   useSyncSearchParamsWithState,
  8 |   useSyncStateWithSearchParams,
  9 | } from "src/components/search/utils/handleSearchParams";
 10 | import { useGetSearchResults } from "src/components/search/utils/useGetSearchResults";
 11 | import { LocatorProvider } from "./utils/useLocator";
 12 | import { LocationProfile } from "src/types/entities";
 13 | import "src/components/search/Locator.css";
 14 | import mapStyles from "src/components/search/defaultMapStyles.json";
 15 | import SearchBox from "src/components/search/SearchBox";
 16 | import LocatorCard from "src/components/cards/LocatorCard";
 17 | import ResultInfo from "src/components/search/ResultInfo";
 18 | import ResultList from "src/components/search/ResultList";
 19 | import CustomMarker from "src/components/search/CustomMarker";
 20 | import LoadingSpinner from "src/components/common/LoadingSpinner";
 21 | import { getMapKey } from "src/common/getMapKey";
 22 | 
 23 | type LocatorProps = {
 24 |   // Will display results up to the verticalLimit (default 20, change with searchActions.setVerticalLimit(num))
 25 |   displayAllOnNoResults?: boolean;
 26 |   placeholderText?: string;
 27 |   subTitle: string;
 28 |   title: string;
 29 |   allResultsOnLoad?: boolean;
 30 | };
 31 | 
 32 | const Locator = (props: LocatorProps) => {
 33 |   const {
 34 |     displayAllOnNoResults = false,
 35 |     allResultsOnLoad = false,
 36 |     placeholderText,
 37 |     subTitle,
 38 |     title,
 39 |   } = props;
 40 |   const mapKey = getMapKey();
 41 |   const [selectedEntityId, setSelectedEntityId] = useState("");
 42 |   const [focusedEntityId, setFocusedEntityId] = useState("");
 43 |   const [hoveredEntityId, setHoveredEntityId] = useState("");
 44 | 
 45 |   const searchActions = useSearchActions();
 46 |   const isLoading = useSearchState((state) => state.searchStatus.isLoading);
 47 |   const isDesktopBreakpoint = useBreakpoint("sm");
 48 |   const [allLocationsLoaded, setAllLocationsLoaded] = useState(false);
 49 |   const [initialParamsLoaded, setInitialParamsLoaded] = useState(false);
 50 |   const initialParamsLoadedCallback = useCallback(
 51 |     () => setInitialParamsLoaded(true),
 52 |     [setInitialParamsLoaded]
 53 |   );
 54 | 
 55 |   // Load static and facet filters on page load.
 56 |   useLoadInitialSearchParams(initialParamsLoaded, initialParamsLoadedCallback);
 57 |   // Update the search params whenever the search state filters property changes.
 58 |   useSyncSearchParamsWithState(initialParamsLoaded);
 59 |   // Update the state only on history change.
 60 |   useSyncStateWithSearchParams();
 61 | 
 62 |   // Unset any selected, hovered, or focused markers on new search
 63 |   useEffect(() => {
 64 |     setSelectedEntityId("");
 65 |     setFocusedEntityId("");
 66 |     setHoveredEntityId("");
 67 |   }, [searchActions.state.query.queryId]);
 68 | 
 69 |   const results = useGetSearchResults<LocationProfile>(
 70 |     displayAllOnNoResults,
 71 |     allResultsOnLoad,
 72 |     () => {
 73 |       setAllLocationsLoaded(true);
 74 |     }
 75 |   );
 76 | 
 77 |   return (
 78 |     <LocatorProvider
 79 |       value={{
 80 |         results,
 81 |         selectedId: selectedEntityId,
 82 |         setSelectedId: setSelectedEntityId,
 83 |         focusedId: focusedEntityId,
 84 |         setFocusedId: setFocusedEntityId,
 85 |         hoveredId: hoveredEntityId,
 86 |         setHoveredId: setHoveredEntityId,
 87 |       }}
 88 |     >
 89 |       <div className="Locator">
 90 |         {(!initialParamsLoaded ||
 91 |           isLoading ||
 92 |           (allResultsOnLoad && !allLocationsLoaded)) && <LoadingSpinner />}
 93 |         <div className="Locator-content">
 94 |           <SearchBox
 95 |             title={title}
 96 |             subTitle={subTitle}
 97 |             placeholderText={placeholderText}
 98 |           />
 99 |           <ResultInfo />
100 |           <ResultList CardComponent={LocatorCard} />
101 |         </div>
102 |         {isDesktopBreakpoint && (
103 |           <div className="Locator-map">
104 |             <Map
105 |               provider={GoogleMaps}
106 |               providerOptions={{ styles: mapStyles }}
107 |               bounds={results.map((data) => data.rawData.yextDisplayCoordinate)}
108 |               padding={{ top: 100, bottom: 200, left: 50, right: 50 }}
109 |               className="h-full"
110 |               {...mapKey}
111 |             >
112 |               {results.map((data, index) => (
113 |                 <CustomMarker
114 |                   key={data.rawData.id}
115 |                   coordinate={data.rawData.yextDisplayCoordinate}
116 |                   id={data.rawData.id}
117 |                   index={index + 1}
118 |                 />
119 |               ))}
120 |             </Map>
121 |           </div>
122 |         )}
123 |       </div>
124 |     </LocatorProvider>
125 |   );
126 | };
127 | 
128 | export default Locator;
129 |

 1 | import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
 2 | import { useSearchActions } from "@yext/search-headless-react";

 9 | const ResultInfo = () => {

12 |

14 |   useEffect(() => {

17 |     };

21 |   }, []);

28 |           onClick={() => setFiltersOpen(false)}
29 |         ></div>
30 |       )}
31 |       <div className="flex items-center">
32 |         <ResultSummary />
33 |         <FiltersButton
34 |           filtersOpen={filtersOpen}
35 |           setFiltersOpen={setFiltersOpen}
36 |         />
37 |       </div>
38 |       {isDesktop && <ActiveFacets />}
39 |       {filtersOpen && <FacetsModal setFiltersOpen={setFiltersOpen} />}
40 |     </div>
41 |   );
42 | };
43 | 
44 | type FiltersButtonProps = {
45 |   filtersOpen: boolean;
46 |   setFiltersOpen: React.Dispatch<React.SetStateAction<boolean>>;
47 | };
48 | 
49 | const FiltersButton = (props: FiltersButtonProps) => {
50 |   const searchActions = useSearchActions();
51 |   const facets = searchActions.state.filters.facets;
52 |   const facetsAvailable = facets?.filter((facet) => facet.options.length).length
53 |     ? true
54 |     : false;
55 |   const numActiveFacets = facets
56 |     ?.map((facet) => facet.options.filter((f) => f.selected).length)
57 |     .reduce((prev, curr) => prev + curr, 0);
58 | 
59 |   if (!facetsAvailable) return null;
60 | 
61 |   return (
62 |     <button
63 |       className="flex items-center ml-auto"
64 |       onClick={() => props.setFiltersOpen(!props.filtersOpen)}
65 |     >
66 |       <span className="text-brand-primary mr-2.5 whitespace-nowrap">
67 |         {`Filters ${numActiveFacets ? `(${numActiveFacets})` : ""}`}
68 |       </span>
69 |       <MdFilterList className="text-brand-primary" />
70 |     </button>
71 |   );
72 | };

74 | export default ResultInfo;

 1 | import { useMemo } from "react";
 2 | import { useSearchState } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
 3 | import type { State } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
 4 | import { LOCATOR_STATIC_FILTER_FIELD } from "src/config";
 5 | import { useTemplateData } from "src/common/useTemplateData";
 6 | import { checkIsLocationFilter } from "src/components/search/utils/checkIsLocationFilter";
 7 | import { useLocator } from "./utils/useLocator";
 8 | 
 9 | const ResultSummary = () => {
10 |   const searchState = useSearchState((state) => state);
11 |   const { relativePrefixToRoot } = useTemplateData();
12 |   const { results } = useLocator();
13 |   const resultsText = useMemo(
14 |     () => getResultsCountText(searchState, results.length),
15 |     [searchState, results.length]
16 |   );
17 | 
18 |   // Element to render for results summary when page is first loaded before a search is made.
19 |   const initialSummaryText = (
20 |     <span>
21 |       Use our locator to find a location near you or{" "}
22 |       <a href={relativePrefixToRoot + "index.html"} className="link-underline">
23 |         browse our directory
24 |       </a>
25 |       .
26 |     </span>
27 |   );
28 | 
29 |   return (
30 |     <div className="mr-4">
31 |       {searchState.query.queryId ? resultsText : initialSummaryText}
32 |     </div>
33 |   );
34 | };
35 | 
36 | function getResultsCountText(state: State, resultsCount: number) {
37 |   let searchPlace = "";
38 | 
39 |   if (state.filters.static?.length) {
40 |     // Make sure to get the match to the correct filter in case multiple are set.
41 |     const activeFilter =
42 |       state.filters.static.find(
43 |         (f) =>
44 |           f.selected &&
45 |           f.filter.kind === "fieldValue" &&
46 |           // If the locator is searching on "builtin.location", check if the selected filter is also a location filter.
47 |           // Otherwise just match the locator filter fieldId to the selected filter fieldId.
48 |           (LOCATOR_STATIC_FILTER_FIELD === "builtin.location"
49 |             ? checkIsLocationFilter(f.filter)
50 |             : LOCATOR_STATIC_FILTER_FIELD === f.filter.fieldId) &&
51 |           f.displayName
52 |       ) ?? null;
53 |     if (activeFilter?.displayName) {
54 |       searchPlace = activeFilter.displayName;
55 |     }
56 |   }
57 | 
58 |   if (searchPlace) {
59 |     if (resultsCount === 0) {
60 |       return `No locations found near "${searchPlace}".`;
61 |     }
62 |     if (resultsCount === 1) {
63 |       return `${resultsCount} location near "${searchPlace}".`;
64 |     }
65 |     return `${resultsCount} locations near "${searchPlace}".`;
66 |   }
67 | 
68 |   if (resultsCount === 0) {
69 |     return `No locations found.`;
70 |   }
71 |   if (resultsCount === 1) {
72 |     return `${resultsCount} location found.`;
73 |   }
74 |   return `${resultsCount} locations found.`;
75 | }
76 | 
77 | export default ResultSummary;
78 |

32 |               filterSearchContainer: "absolute w-full",
33 |             }}
34 |             label=""
35 |             placeholder={placeholderText}
36 |             searchFields={searchFields}
37 |             onSelect={({
38 |               currentFilter,
39 |               executeFilterSearch,
40 |               newDisplayName,
41 |               newFilter,
42 |               setCurrentFilter,
43 |             }) => {
44 |               // Update static filters.
45 |               if (currentFilter) {
46 |                 searchActions.setFilterOption({
47 |                   filter: currentFilter,
48 |                   selected: false,
49 |                 });
50 |               }
51 |               searchActions.setFilterOption({
52 |                 filter: newFilter,
53 |                 displayName: newDisplayName,
54 |                 selected: true,
55 |               });
56 |               setCurrentFilter(newFilter);
57 |               executeFilterSearch(newDisplayName);
58 | 
59 |               // Execute search on select.
60 |               searchActions.setOffset(0);
61 |               searchActions.resetFacets();
62 |               executeSearch(searchActions);
63 |             }}
64 |           />
65 |         </div>
66 |         <GeolocateButton className="ml-4" />
67 |       </div>
68 |     </div>
69 |   );
70 | };

72 | export default SearchBox;

 1 | import { FieldValueStaticFilter } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
 2 | 
 3 | // Check if a static filter came from a search on the "builtin.location" search fieldId.
 4 | // FilterSearch can return several different filters depending on the type of search made (location, region, or country).
 5 | // The returned filterIds can be "builtin.locaiton", "builtin.region", or "address.countryCode".
 6 | // See here for more details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1czipixNt3dIVPQ9Xe3leM_FJQgG03i2_8L76RILeNIk/edit#heading=h.nc11yk7bgxbg
 7 | export const checkIsLocationFilter = (filter: FieldValueStaticFilter) => {
 8 |   return (
 9 |     filter.fieldId === "builtin.location" ||
10 |     filter.fieldId === "builtin.region" ||
11 |     filter.fieldId === "address.countryCode"
12 |   );
13 | };

  1 | /**
  2 |  * The encoding and decoding between search state static + facet filters and URLSearchParams.
  3 |  */
  4 | 
  5 | import type {
  6 |   DisplayableFacetOption,
  7 |   DisplayableFacet,
  8 |   FieldValueStaticFilter,
  9 |   NearFilterValue,
 10 |   SelectableStaticFilter,
 11 |   SearchHeadless,
 12 | } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
 13 | import { Matcher } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
 14 | import { getUserLocation } from "@yext/search-ui-react";
 15 | import {
 16 |   GEOLOCATE_RADIUS,
 17 |   LOCATOR_ENTITY_TYPE,
 18 |   LOCATOR_STATIC_FILTER_FIELD,
 19 | } from "src/config";
 20 | import { checkIsLocationFilter } from "./checkIsLocationFilter";
 21 | import { locationFilterToType, locationTypeToFilter } from "./helpers";
 22 | 
 23 | // Encode search state.filters.static -> URLSearchParams
 24 | export function encodeStaticFilters(filters: SelectableStaticFilter[]) {
 25 |   const selectedFilter = filters.find(
 26 |     (f) => f.selected && f.filter.kind === "fieldValue"
 27 |   );
 28 | 
 29 |   if (!selectedFilter) return null;
 30 | 
 31 |   const searchParams = new URLSearchParams();
 32 |   const activeFilter = selectedFilter?.filter as FieldValueStaticFilter;
 33 | 
 34 |   if (selectedFilter?.displayName) {
 35 |     searchParams.set("qp", selectedFilter?.displayName);
 36 |   }
 37 |   if (activeFilter.matcher === Matcher.Equals) {
 38 |     searchParams.set("q", activeFilter.value.toString());
 39 | 
 40 |     if (checkIsLocationFilter(activeFilter)) {
 41 |       searchParams.set(
 42 |         "location_type",
 43 |         locationFilterToType(activeFilter.fieldId)
 44 |       );
 45 |     }
 46 |   }
 47 |   if (activeFilter.matcher === Matcher.Near) {
 48 |     const filterValue = activeFilter.value as NearFilterValue;
 49 |     searchParams.set("lat", filterValue.lat.toString());
 50 |     searchParams.set("lng", filterValue.lng.toString());
 51 |     searchParams.set("r", Math.round(filterValue.radius / 1609).toString());
 52 |   }
 53 | 
 54 |   return searchParams;
 55 | }
 56 | 
 57 | // Decode URLSearchParams -> search state.filters.static
 58 | export async function decodeStaticFilters(
 59 |   searchParams: URLSearchParams,
 60 |   searchActions: SearchHeadless
 61 | ) {
 62 |   // Get values from URL.
 63 |   const query = searchParams.get("q");
 64 |   const prettyQuery = searchParams.get("qp");
 65 |   const locationType = searchParams.get("location_type");
 66 |   const lat = searchParams.get("lat");
 67 |   const lng = searchParams.get("lng");
 68 |   const radius = searchParams.get("r");
 69 | 
 70 |   // If the locator is using 'builtin.location' as the filterId for FilterSearch,
 71 |   // load the correct corresponding filterId for the given location type.
 72 |   const locationFilterId =
 73 |     LOCATOR_STATIC_FILTER_FIELD === "builtin.location" && locationType
 74 |       ? locationTypeToFilter(locationType)
 75 |       : LOCATOR_STATIC_FILTER_FIELD;
 76 | 
 77 |   let staticFilter: SelectableStaticFilter | null = null;
 78 | 
 79 |   // If the filter value is available, set a filter with a string value in state.
 80 |   if (query) {
 81 |     staticFilter = {
 82 |       displayName: prettyQuery ?? "",
 83 |       filter: {
 84 |         fieldId: locationFilterId,
 85 |         kind: "fieldValue",
 86 |         matcher: Matcher.Equals,
 87 |         value: query,
 88 |       },
 89 |       selected: true,
 90 |     };
 91 |   }
 92 | 
 93 |   // If the lat and lng search params are available, set a filter with a NearFilterValue value in state.
 94 |   else if (lat && lng) {
 95 |     staticFilter = {
 96 |       displayName: prettyQuery ?? "",
 97 |       filter: {
 98 |         fieldId: "builtin.location",
 99 |         kind: "fieldValue",
100 |         matcher: Matcher.Near,
101 |         value: {
102 |           lat: parseFloat(lat),
103 |           lng: parseFloat(lng),
104 |           radius: radius ? 1609 * parseInt(radius) : 1609 * GEOLOCATE_RADIUS,
105 |         },
106 |       },
107 |       selected: true,
108 |     };
109 |   }
110 | 
111 |   // If the pretty query is "My Location", attempt to geolocate the user and
112 |   // use their position to set a filter with a NearFilterValue value in state.
113 |   else if (prettyQuery === "My Location") {
114 |     try {
115 |       const position = await getUserLocation();
116 | 
117 |       // Update user location bias.
118 |       // Does this need to happen though?
119 |       searchActions.setUserLocation({
120 |         latitude: position.coords.latitude,
121 |         longitude: position.coords.longitude,
122 |       });
123 | 
124 |       // Create Near static filter
125 |       staticFilter = {
126 |         displayName: prettyQuery,
127 |         filter: {
128 |           fieldId: "builtin.location",
129 |           kind: "fieldValue",
130 |           matcher: Matcher.Near,
131 |           value: {
132 |             lat: position.coords.latitude,
133 |             lng: position.coords.longitude,
134 |             radius: radius ? 1609 * parseInt(radius) : 1609 * GEOLOCATE_RADIUS,
135 |           },
136 |         },
137 |         selected: true,
138 |       };
139 |     } catch (e) {
140 |       alert("User location could not be determined.");
141 |       console.error(e);
142 |     }
143 |   }
144 | 
145 |   // If only the pretty query is available, use it to find the top
146 |   // autocomplete option and select that to set the filter in state.
147 |   else if (prettyQuery) {
148 |     // Get FilterSearch autocomplete results for the displayName.
149 |     const autocompleteOptions = await searchActions.executeFilterSearch(
150 |       prettyQuery,
151 |       false,
152 |       [
153 |         {
154 |           fieldApiName: LOCATOR_STATIC_FILTER_FIELD,
155 |           entityType: LOCATOR_ENTITY_TYPE,
156 |           fetchEntities: false,
157 |         },
158 |       ]
159 |     );
160 | 
161 |     // Use the first autocomplete result as the static filter.
162 |     const topResult = autocompleteOptions?.sections[0].results[0];
163 |     if (topResult?.filter) {
164 |       staticFilter = {
165 |         displayName: topResult.value,
166 |         filter: {
167 |           fieldId: topResult.filter.fieldId,
168 |           kind: "fieldValue",
169 |           matcher: topResult.filter.matcher,
170 |           value: topResult.filter.value,
171 |         },
172 |         selected: true,
173 |       };
174 |     }
175 |   }
176 | 
177 |   return staticFilter;
178 | }
179 | 
180 | // Schema for the facets search param value.
181 | type FacetParamSchema = Record<string, string[]>;
182 | 
183 | // Encode search state.filters.static -> URLSearchParams
184 | export function encodeFacetFilters(facets: DisplayableFacet[]) {
185 |   const activeFacets: FacetParamSchema = {};
186 | 
187 |   facets.forEach((facet) => {
188 |     const isActive = facet.options.some((option) => option.selected);
189 |     if (isActive) {
190 |       const activeOptions = facet.options
191 |         .filter((f) => f.selected)
192 |         .map((f) => f.value)
193 |         .filter((val): val is string => typeof val === "string");
194 | 
195 |       activeFacets[facet.fieldId] = activeOptions;
196 |     }
197 |   });
198 | 
199 |   if (Object.keys(activeFacets).length) {
200 |     const searchParams = new URLSearchParams({
201 |       facets: JSON.stringify(activeFacets),
202 |     });
203 |     return searchParams;
204 |   }
205 | 
206 |   return null;
207 | }
208 | 
209 | // Decode URLSearchParams -> search state.filters.facets
210 | export function decodeFacetFilters(searchParams: URLSearchParams) {
211 |   const facets = searchParams.get("facets");
212 |   // If the facets search param key exists, parse back into JSON.
213 |   const parsedFacets = facets ? (JSON.parse(facets) as FacetParamSchema) : null;
214 | 
215 |   let facetFilters: DisplayableFacet[] = [];
216 | 
217 |   if (parsedFacets) {
218 |     for (const [fieldId, options] of Object.entries(parsedFacets)) {
219 |       const optionsToAdd: DisplayableFacetOption[] = options.map((option) => ({
220 |         count: 0,
221 |         displayName: option,
222 |         matcher: Matcher.Equals,
223 |         value: option,
224 |         selected: true,
225 |       }));
226 | 
227 |       if (optionsToAdd.length) {
228 |         facetFilters.push({
229 |           displayName: "",
230 |           fieldId: fieldId,
231 |           options: optionsToAdd,
232 |         });
233 |       }
234 |     }
235 |   }
236 | 
237 |   return facetFilters;
238 | }
239 |

  1 | import { useEffect } from "react";
  2 | import { useSearchActions, useSearchState } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
  3 | import { useLocation, useSearchParams } from "react-router-dom";
  4 | import {
  5 |   decodeFacetFilters,
  6 |   decodeStaticFilters,
  7 |   encodeFacetFilters,
  8 |   encodeStaticFilters,
  9 | } from "./filterEncodings";
 10 | 
 11 | // Decode the URLSearchParams into search state on page load.
 12 | export function useLoadInitialSearchParams(
 13 |   paramsLoaded: boolean,
 14 |   callback?: () => void
 15 | ) {
 16 |   const [searchParams, setSearchParams] = useSearchParams();
 17 |   const searchActions = useSearchActions();
 18 | 
 19 |   useEffect(() => {
 20 |     // Don't run again after params are loaded.
 21 |     if (paramsLoaded) return;
 22 | 
 23 |     async function loadInitialParams() {
 24 |       const staticFilter = await decodeStaticFilters(
 25 |         searchParams,
 26 |         searchActions
 27 |       );
 28 |       const facetFilters = decodeFacetFilters(searchParams);
 29 | 
 30 |       if (staticFilter) {
 31 |         searchActions.setStaticFilters([staticFilter]);
 32 |         searchActions.setFacets(facetFilters);
 33 | 
 34 |         try {
 35 |           await searchActions.executeVerticalQuery();
 36 |         } catch (error) {
 37 |           console.error(error);
 38 |         }
 39 |       }
 40 | 
 41 |       // If a callback prop is passed, invoke it now.
 42 |       // Useful for indicating that all the url params have been loaded.
 43 |       if (callback) {
 44 |         callback();
 45 |       }
 46 |     }
 47 |     loadInitialParams();
 48 |   }, [searchActions, searchParams, setSearchParams, paramsLoaded, callback]);
 49 | }
 50 | 
 51 | // On change in search state, encode the state into URLSearchParams and push to window.history if there is a delta.
 52 | export function useSyncSearchParamsWithState(initialParamsLoaded: boolean) {
 53 |   const searchActions = useSearchActions();
 54 |   const [searchParams, setSearchParams] = useSearchParams();
 55 |   const filters = useSearchState((s) => s.filters);
 56 | 
 57 |   useEffect(() => {
 58 |     // Don't register listeners on page load until all of the initial params are loaded.
 59 |     if (!initialParamsLoaded) return;
 60 | 
 61 |     const encodedStatic = encodeStaticFilters(filters?.static || []);
 62 |     const encodedFacets = encodeFacetFilters(filters?.facets || []);
 63 |     let newSearchString = "";
 64 | 
 65 |     if (encodedStatic) {
 66 |       newSearchString += encodedStatic.toString();
 67 | 
 68 |       // Add facets if static filter exists.
 69 |       if (encodedFacets) {
 70 |         newSearchString += `&${encodedFacets.toString()}`;
 71 |       }
 72 |     }
 73 | 
 74 |     // Avoid pushing an identical URLSearchParams string.
 75 |     if (newSearchString !== searchParams.toString()) {
 76 |       setSearchParams(newSearchString);
 77 |     }
 78 |   }, [filters, initialParamsLoaded]);
 79 | }
 80 | 
 81 | // On change in window location, check if the decoded URLSearchParams match the current search state and update if there is a delta.
 82 | export function useSyncStateWithSearchParams() {
 83 |   const searchActions = useSearchActions();
 84 |   const [searchParams, _] = useSearchParams();
 85 |   const location = useLocation();
 86 | 
 87 |   useEffect(() => {
 88 |     async function loadParams() {
 89 |       const staticFilter = await decodeStaticFilters(
 90 |         searchParams,
 91 |         searchActions
 92 |       );
 93 |       const facetFilters = decodeFacetFilters(searchParams);
 94 | 
 95 |       if (staticFilter) {
 96 |         searchActions.setStaticFilters([staticFilter]);
 97 |         searchActions.setFacets(facetFilters);
 98 | 
 99 |         try {
100 |           await searchActions.executeVerticalQuery();
101 |         } catch (error) {
102 |           console.error(error);
103 |         }
104 |       } else {
105 |         // Reset back to initial search state.
106 |         searchActions.setStaticFilters([]);
107 |         searchActions.setFacets([]);
108 |         searchActions.setState({
109 |           ...searchActions.state,
110 |           vertical: {
111 |             ...searchActions.state.vertical,
112 |             results: undefined,
113 |           },
114 |           query: {},
115 |         });
116 |       }
117 |     }
118 | 
119 |     let updateNeeded = false;
120 |     const facets = searchParams.get("facets");
121 |     const searchParamsWithoutFacets = new URLSearchParams(searchParams);
122 |     searchParamsWithoutFacets.delete("facets");
123 | 
124 |     // If the current static filter in state doesn't match the decoded static filter from the URLSearchParams perform an update.
125 |     const encodedCurrentStaticFilter =
126 |       encodeStaticFilters(searchActions.state.filters?.static || []) ??
127 |       new URLSearchParams();
128 |     if (
129 |       encodedCurrentStaticFilter?.toString() !==
130 |       searchParamsWithoutFacets.toString()
131 |     ) {
132 |       updateNeeded = true;
133 |     }
134 | 
135 |     // If the current facet filters in state don't match the decoded facet filters from the URLSearchParams perform an update.
136 |     const encodedCurrentFacets =
137 |       encodeFacetFilters(searchActions.state.filters.facets || []) ??
138 |       new URLSearchParams();
139 |     if (encodedCurrentFacets.get("facets") !== facets) {
140 |       updateNeeded = true;
141 |     }
142 | 
143 |     if (updateNeeded) {
144 |       loadParams();
145 |     }
146 |   }, [location]);
147 | }
148 |

 1 | // Convert a static filter fieldId to a URL param to distinguish location filter types.
 2 | export function locationFilterToType(filterId: string) {
 3 |   return filterId === "builtin.location"
 4 |     ? "location"
 5 |     : filterId === "builtin.region"
 6 |     ? "region"
 7 |     : "country";
 8 | }
 9 | 
10 | // Convert a location filter type param to the actual location filter fieldId.
11 | export function locationTypeToFilter(type: string) {
12 |   return type === "location"
13 |     ? "builtin.location"
14 |     : type === "region"
15 |     ? "builtin.region"
16 |     : "address.countryCode";
17 | }
18 | 
19 | export function combineSearchParams(
20 |   params1: URLSearchParams,
21 |   params2: URLSearchParams
22 | ) {
23 |   const combinedParams = new URLSearchParams();
24 |   for (const [key, val] of params1.entries()) {
25 |     combinedParams.set(key, val);
26 |   }
27 |   for (const [key, val] of params2.entries()) {
28 |     combinedParams.set(key, val);
29 |   }
30 |   return combinedParams;
31 | }

 1 | import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
 2 | import {
 3 |   Result,
 4 |   SearchCore,
 5 |   useSearchState,
 6 |   useSearchActions,
 7 | } from "@yext/search-headless-react";
 8 | 
 9 | async function fetchAll<T>(
10 |   core: SearchCore,
11 |   verticalKey: string,
12 |   limit = Infinity
13 | ) {
14 |   async function fetchPage(offset: number) {
15 |     const res = await core.verticalSearch({
16 |       query: "",
17 |       verticalKey: verticalKey,
18 |       limit: Math.min(limit, 50),
19 |       offset,
20 |       retrieveFacets: false,
21 |       skipSpellCheck: true,
22 |     });
23 |     return res;
24 |   }
25 | 
26 |   const res = await fetchPage(0);
27 | 
28 |   const searches = [Promise.resolve(res)];
29 |   const per = 50; // Max number of entities allowed per response
30 |   const totalEntities = Math.min(res.verticalResults.resultsCount, limit);
31 | 
32 |   for (
33 |     let offset = res.verticalResults.results.length;
34 |     offset < totalEntities;
35 |     offset += per
36 |   ) {
37 |     searches.push(fetchPage(offset));
38 |   }
39 |   const out: Result<T>[] = [];
40 |   await Promise.all(searches).then((responses) => {
41 |     for (const response of responses) {
42 |       out.push(...(response.verticalResults.results as Result<T>[]));
43 |     }
44 |   });
45 |   return out;
46 | }
47 | 
48 | // Get the results from the search state and cast to the given type.
49 | export function useGetSearchResults<T>(
50 |   displayAllOnNoResults?: boolean,
51 |   allResultsOnLoad?: boolean,
52 |   allResultsLoadedCallback?: () => void
53 | ) {
54 |   const [allResults, setAllResults] = useState<Result<T>[]>([]);
55 |   const actions = useSearchActions();
56 |   const state = useSearchState((s) => s);
57 |   const initialLoad = !state.query.queryId;
58 | 
59 |   useEffect(() => {
60 |     if (!allResultsOnLoad || !state.vertical.verticalKey) return;
61 |     async function load() {
62 |       // @ts-expect-error core is private, but we want to reuse the same core as the
63 |       // locator, rather than needing to create a new instance with the same configuration
64 |       // it's less convenient to use it indirectly through searchActions.executeVerticalQuery
65 |       // because that doesn't provide us direct access to results
66 |       const res = await fetchAll<T>(actions.core, state.vertical.verticalKey);
67 |       setAllResults(res);
68 |       if (allResultsLoadedCallback) allResultsLoadedCallback();
69 |     }
70 |     load();
71 |   }, []);
72 | 
73 |   const vertical = useSearchState((state) => state.vertical);
74 |   const verticalResults = vertical.results;
75 |   const allResultsForVertical =
76 |     vertical?.noResults?.allResultsForVertical.results;
77 | 
78 |   if (initialLoad && allResultsOnLoad) return allResults;
79 | 
80 |   const results = verticalResults?.length
81 |     ? verticalResults
82 |     : displayAllOnNoResults
83 |     ? allResultsForVertical
84 |     : [];
85 | 
86 |   return results as Result<T>[];
87 | }
88 |

/src/i18n.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import i18n from "i18next";
 2 | import {
 3 |   useTranslation as usei18nextTranslation,
 4 |   initReactI18next,
 5 | } from "react-i18next";
 6 | import type { Resource } from "i18next";
 7 | 
 8 | export async function getTranslations(localeCode: string) {
 9 |   return await import(`../locales/${localeCode}/translation.json`)
10 |     .then((module) => ({ [localeCode]: { translation: module.default } }))
11 |     .catch(() => {
12 |       console.error(`unable to load translations for: ${localeCode}`);
13 |       return {};
14 |     });
15 | }
16 | 
17 | export function initi18n(resources: Resource, locale: string) {
18 | 
19 |   i18n
20 |     .use(initReactI18next) // passes i18n down to react-i18next
21 |     .init({
22 |       resources,
23 |       compatibilityJSON: "v3",
24 |       returnEmptyString: false,
25 |       interpolation: {
26 |         escapeValue: false, // react already safes from xss
27 |       },
28 |     });
29 |   i18n.changeLanguage(locale);
30 |   return i18n;
31 | }
32 | 
33 | export function useTranslation() {
34 |   const { t, ...rest } = usei18nextTranslation();
35 |   return {
36 |     // @ts-expect-error typings for `t` are complicated
37 |     t: (key, ...args) => {
38 |       if (args.length > 0) {
39 |         // @ts-expect-error see above
40 |         return t(key, ...args);
41 |       } else {
42 |         return t(key, key);
43 |       }
44 |     },
45 |     ...rest,
46 |   };
47 | }
48 |

15 |       "id",

17 |       "meta",
18 |       "name",
19 |       "slug",

29 |     ],

31 |     filter: filter || {
32 |       savedFilterIds: ["dm_defaultDirectory_address_city"],
33 |     },
34 |     // The entity language profiles that documents will be generated for.
35 |     localization: {
36 |       locales: ["en"],

 1 | /**
 2 |  * This is an example of how to create a template that makes use of streams data.
 3 |  * The stream data originates from Yext's Knowledge Graph. When a template in
 4 |  * concert with a stream is built by the Yext Sites system, a static html page
 5 |  * is generated for every corresponding (based on the filter) stream document.
 6 |  *
 7 |  * Another way to think about it is that a page will be generated using this
 8 |  * template for every eligible entity in your Knowledge Graph.
 9 |  */
10 | import { LazyLoadWrapper } from "src/components/common/LazyLoadWrapper";
11 | import type { LocationProfile, TemplateRenderProps } from "src/types/entities";
12 | 
13 | import Breadcrumbs from "src/components/common/Breadcrumbs";
14 | import About from "src/components/entity/About";
15 | import Banner from "src/components/entity/Banner";
16 | import Core from "src/components/entity/Core";
17 | import Events from "src/components/entity/Events";
18 | import FAQs from "src/components/entity/FAQs";
19 | import Gallery from "src/components/entity/Gallery";
20 | import Hero from "src/components/entity/Hero";
21 | import Insights from "src/components/entity/Insights";
22 | import Nearby from "src/components/entity/Nearby";
23 | import Products from "src/components/entity/Products";
24 | import Promo from "src/components/entity/Promo";
25 | import Reviews from "src/components/entity/Reviews";
26 | import Team from "src/components/entity/Team";
27 | 
28 | import type { Template } from "@yext/pages";
29 | import { Main } from "src/layouts/main";
30 | import "src/index.css";
31 | 
32 | interface EntityLayoutProps {
33 |   data: TemplateRenderProps<LocationProfile>;
34 | }
35 | 
36 | const EntityLayout = ({ data }: EntityLayoutProps) => {
37 |   const { dm_directoryParents_defaultdirectory: directoryParents } =
38 |     data.document;
39 | 
40 |   return (
41 |     <>
42 |       <Banner hasCloseBtn={true} />
43 |       <Breadcrumbs
44 |         breadcrumbs={directoryParents || []}
45 |         separator="/"
46 |         className="container"
47 |       />
48 |       <Hero />
49 |       <Core />
50 |       <Promo />
51 |       <Products itemsToShow={3} />
52 |       <Events showPastEvents={false} />
53 |       <About />
54 |       <Insights />
55 |       <Gallery />
56 |       <Team initialSize={3} />
57 |       <FAQs />
58 |       <LazyLoadWrapper>
59 |         <Reviews maxReviews={12} numReviewsPerPage={3} />
60 |       </LazyLoadWrapper>
61 |       <LazyLoadWrapper>
62 |         <Nearby />
63 |       </LazyLoadWrapper>
64 |     </>
65 |   );
66 | };
67 | 
68 | /**
69 |  * This is the main template. It can have any name as long as it's the default export.
70 |  * The props passed in here are the direct stream document defined by `config`.
71 |  *
72 |  * There are a bunch of custom components being used from the src/components folder. These are
73 |  * an example of how you could create your own. You can set up your folder structure for custom
74 |  * components any way you'd like as long as it lives in the src folder (though you should not put
75 |  * them in the src/templates folder as this is specific for true template files).
76 |  */
77 | const Entity: Template<TemplateRenderProps<LocationProfile>> = (data) => {
78 |   return (
79 |     <Main data={data}>
80 |       <EntityLayout data={data} />
81 |     </Main>
82 |   );
83 | };

32 |       <MainInternal {...props} />
33 |     </AnalyticsProvider>
34 |   );
35 | };
36 | 
37 | const MainInternal = (props: MainProps) => {
38 |   const { children } = props;
39 | 
40 |   // Create the global window.enableYextAnalytics function for clients that need to get user consent
41 |   // If consent is not required, set requireOptIn on AnalyticsProvider above to false.
42 |   useExposeEnableYAFunction();
43 | 
44 |   return (
45 |     <TemplateDataProvider value={props.data}>
46 |       <Header />
47 |       {children}
48 |       <Footer />
49 |     </TemplateDataProvider>
50 |   );
51 | };
52 | 
53 | export { Main };
